name: Sine Tempore: Silicio
description:
Description from the publisher:

A cold planet in a sector not far from Primevus V emanates a known signal; a spaceship identical to yours is sending an unmistakable message: "Life here is possible". However will it be what you expect? Why is another spaceship so close to yours? Why is it so far off course? ... Silicio will guide you along the discovery of numerous events in waiting behind the "Kraken" on an apparently inhospitable planet, against a totally unexpected enemy.

This box too contains fantastic miniatures, new boards, new objects and a mini narrative campaign with 10 missions, plus 5 new exploration missions. Silicio’s creatures are classified into three types; at the lowest level of the scale, we have the Babooms, obtained by recycling the oldest remains of the Kraken crew. These beings, turned completely crazy by the transformation, will throw themselves onto our Heroes, with no regard for danger. The O.R.C. are lethal assassins who kill their victims with hard-hearted ruthlessness. Silent, and almost invisible, they will put the cold blood of Achab and company to the test. A.D.E., a true killing machine... is the largest miniature that LMS has ever produced. Driven by an O.R.C., this exoskeleton is able to create an incredible amount of fire. Its physical defense is almost impenetrable, but its gynoid nature means it can be used not only by the Enemies...
And of course, how could we not speak of their leader? The first specimen of the Andromeda model, having awakened, has decided to rebel against its owners, killing them only to bring them back to life as mechanical creatures of its own invention. Andromeda is driven by an atavistic hatred for living creatures, second only to her hate for her “younger sister” who replaced her.

This is a Kickstarter exclusive expansion.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: B-Sieged: Encampment Tile Set
description:
The Encampment rules introduce Spawning Points that may move back and forth from Zone 3 to Zone 2 depending on the Summoning rolls, creating a more dynamic pattern of invasion.

When setting up the game with the Encampment Tiles, players will place Spawning Tokens on the board in the indicated spots - these represent the moving enemy Encampments. When a Square symbol is rolled on the Summoning Roll, the Spawning Point will spawn the enemies listed on the corresponding Enemy card and then the Spawning Token is moved forward to Zone 2. A Triangle result will make the Spawning Point continue where it's at, and a Circle result will move the Spawning Point back to Zone 3.

This mobile nature of the Encampment Tile Set brings a new and fresh experience when defending the Citadel! With enemies appearing on Zones 2 and 3, the pressure builds up on the Heroes! Assault units will be one step closer and the Catapult won't be as strong when the Spawning Points are on Zone 2's, but on the other hand, Heavy Units that Spawn on Zone 2 will have to move to Zone 3 before they start firing upon the Citadel, which will buy the Heroes and the Citadel some time! The symbols to the left of the Encampment Tiles indicate the behaviour of the different enemy types, depending on where they are spawned.

The Encampment Tile Set can be played with any B-Sieged enemy army, whether it be the Abyssal Forces from Sons of the Abyss or the Iron Orc nation from the Darkness & Fury expansion!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Warhammer Quest: Silver Tower – Mighty Heroes
description:
From the publisher:
The tales and legends of the Silver Tower are numerous indeed; each recalling a different band of unlikely allies, champions finding themselves banding together in the lair of a Gaunt Summoner of Tzeentch. Some seek the glory of a boon from the Gaunt Summoner, others wish to learn his true name and thus strike him down – all must navigate the sheer horror of the Silver Tower.

Only the greatest champions of both good and evil can hope to succeed. These four heroes have found themselves subject to the Gaunt Summoner’s ever-shifting domain:


a Tzeentch Sorcerer Lord, devious and powerful spell-caster;
a Khorne Bloodbound Slaughterpriest, brutal, murderous demagogue;
a Stormcast Eternals Knight-Venator*, glorious sky-archer of Order;
and a Fyreslayers Auric Runemaster, high priest of the forge-temple.


This box set contains four plastic Citadel miniatures, with rules for use in games of Warhammer Quest: Silver Tower. Includes one Citadel 25mm Round base, one Citadel 32mm Round base, one Citadel 40mm Round base and one Citadel 50mm Round base.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Planet Steam: Golden Eagle
description:
An additional freighter for Planet Steam, fresh from the IPF.

The Golden Eagle carries up to 3 resources of whatever kind.
It gets auctioned at the beginning of phase B. The winner of the auction places his bid beneath the card. During change of year the owner has the opportunity to prolong the rent once for an extra year for the exact amount under the card. The whole amount of credits is then payed to the bank.
If the rent is not prolonged, the Eagle returns to the IPF and is again auctioned. Any resources on the Eagle may be redistributed.

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Percedal Promo
description:
Percedal is a promotional figure for Krosmaster: Arena.

Iops are known for being courageous knights. They will fly into the thick of battle to save their allies without hesitation and perform feats that would break even the most experienced fighters. Percedal is a very talented Iop, being a student of Goultard, one of the strongest Iops in their history. He welds the demon-sword, Rubilax, which hosts a demon of the same name, and is in charge of keeping the demon from escaping into the real world.

In Krosmaster: Arena, Percedal is a an exclusively melee fighter; his only offensive skill requires him to be right next to his target to attack. To help him get close, he can use his other skill to jump around to different areas, giving him one of the highest mobility in the game. If he is paired up with some of his teammates from the Wakfu anime, who are also promotional figures, he gains the ability to hit harder with his attacks while also allowing him to have an easier time preventing enemies from escaping from his grasp.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures

name: Wavell's War
description:
The first Grand Europa module, Wavell's War is a module that links Europa games Balkan Front and War in the Desert together with East Africa. Ownership of both Balkan Front and War in the Desert is required for a complete play of WW, covering 1940 to 1943.

It also updates Balkan Front and War in the Desert rules and counters to the latest Europa standards. It additionally provides previously published optional rules.

The module provides 21 mapsheets covering all of East Africa and much of Sudan and the Arabian peninsula, 1 mapsheet overlay to Balkan Front, 3 countersheets of revised/new counters for Balkan Front and Italian East Africa, extensive play aids including eleven game charts and a scenarios and appendices book.

Includes 16 scenarios. 22 quarter-size maps, 3 countersheets (840 counters).

(from HMS/GRD website & user's description)

name: Star Wars: Legion – Imperial Royal Guards Unit Expansion
description:
Inscrutable behind their blood-red masks, the Imperial Royal Guard will face down anyone who dares threaten the Emperor. While little is known about these enigmatic warriors, one thing is certain: their sole directive is to protect the leader of the Galactic Empire, with their lives if necessary.

The Imperial Royal Guards Unit Expansion contains everything you need to add a unit of Emperor Palpatine's personal bodyguards to your army. The squad of four unpainted, easily assembled miniatures stands ready to protect the Emperor or do his bidding on any planet across the galaxy. Meanwhile, the Royal Guards are also accompanied by five distinct upgrade cards that invite you to outfit them with even more tools for protecting the Emperor.

—description from the publisher

name: Princes of the Renaissance: Expansion Bundle
description:
The Expansion Bundle for Princes of the Renaissance introduces:


6 player boards;
Extra Event Tiles (this expansion adds two new Event Tiles to each era in the game so the players cannot be 100% certain which events will affect play until the next era is upon them. This rewards players who have a flexible strategy, and further enhances the game's replayability);
Extra City Tiles (each city would now have two alternate City Tiles that create some variability to the gameplay);
Pope Standee;
Extra Gold and Influence Counters.

name: Corps Command: Dawn's Early Light – Red Hammer
description:
Now you command Soviet and NATO forces during the first battles of the Third World War. Seven scenarios give you the opportunity to explore the desperate fighting in the Eisenbach Gap and Gerzenburg. Dawn's Early Light: Red Hammer is the 2nd expanded edition of Dawn's Early Light and now includes the High Noon at Gerzenberg expansion from Line of Fire magazine #10. Dawn's Early Light Red Hammer is set in a hypothetical 1985 as World War 3 starts. The game uses variable initiative, support element chit pulls, and a novel combat resolution mechanic to create a game modeling the lethality of the modern battlefield with a minimum of rules overhead.

Dawn's Early Light Red Hammer has been refined, corrected, and polished. This edition has updated game manual, counters, player aid card and map. The game map is now printed on a heavy paper stock in vibrant color and also includes a newly designed full-color box. Players can control forces of America, Canada, West Germany and the Soviet Union.

Dawn's Early Light Red Hammer is easy to learn and play in an evening, so get ready to play.
categories: Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Star Trek: Away Missions – Commander Sela: Romulan Expansion
description:
The Romulans are always after more Intel on their foes, learning their strengths and weaknesses and how to defeat them.
While doing so they will be running plots within plots, planning assassinations and devious stratagems to derail their opponent’s plans.

Romulans avoid conflict until they have a decisive advantage, then make a well-directed surgical strike.

—description from the publisher

This pack includes one additional power card for each playable character from Sentinel Tactics: The Flame of Freedom and Sentinel Tactics: Uprising.

Each character has a deck of 6 Power Cards that they select from on their turns. These extra Power Cards give each hero and villain additional capabilities.

name: Dreamscape: Red Raven
description:
Lurking in the shadows, it is there. This oppressive presence, you always felt it. Guiding your steps to the darkest recesses of your dreams, you hardly dare to look at it when it finally appears on your way.

Sometimes you chase it, gathering enough strength to face your nightmares, but you know that sooner or later it will be watching you, darkening your sweetest dreams. Will you finally be able to free yourself from its harmful hold?

—description from the publisher

In the vast depths of space, one can find countless wonders—comets with icy trails, nebulas filled with ionizing gas, or even living creatures, like mynocks, hiding within wreckage.

In addition to asteroids, debris fields, and gas clouds, the Never Tell Me the Odds Obstacles Pack contains six environment cards that reflect a few of the strange and terrifying places a space battle could erupt. Each environment card changes the placement or rules around obstacles, adding variety to your X-Wing games!

name: Russian Railroads: Manufactory Train
description:
A mini-extension available as a free "Print & Play" version. Just print it and cut it out.

Setup:
• Place the manufactory train next to the game board, clearly visible for all players.
• Shuffle all 11 manufactory tiles, face-down, draw 2 of them at random and place them on the 2 right spaces on the manufactory train, faceup. The first space remains empty for now.
• Draw 3 more tiles and place them next to the manufactory train-board, on the left, faceup.• Put the stack of 6 remaining manu-factory tiles above the train-board.

Gameplay:
The manufactory train works like any other action space in RRR.
• If you place a worker or coin on the train, you have to pick one of the 3 faceup manufactory tiles and place it onto the first (empty) space on the train – the space right behind the engine.
• Next you have to perform all three actions, shown on the manufactory tiles, in their entirety. If that is not possible, you cannot use the manufactory train action space. The order, however, is up to you.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Print & Play, Trains
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Worker Placement

name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Razor Crest Expansion Pack
description:
Once a military patrol craft used in the time before the Empire, the Razor Crest is now the craft, and home, of the storied Mandalorian bounty hunter, Din Djarin. Now, the Mandalorian uses the Razor Crest to search the galaxy in an attempt to reunite The Child with its own kind. Perhaps the most iconic and popular starship in recent memory, the Razor Crest Expansion Pack also introduces some of the most requested characters seen in The Mandalorian to your games of Star Wars X-Wing.

X-Wing 2nd ed.: Razor Crest Expansion Pack contains everything you need to add a ST-70 Assault Ship to your Scum and Villainy squadrons, including a beautifully painted miniature in the Razor Crest color scheme, a maneuver dial, and tokens. Additionally, four ship cards let you choose the pilots who fly this iconic assault ship into battle and fourteen upgrade cards invite you to customize your ship to fit your strategy.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Variable Set-up
publishers: Atomic Mass Games, Fantasy Flight Games

name: Fields of Green: Cabbages
description:
Description from the publisher:

This card does something different than every other card introduced so far in the game. It has an Ongoing ability (as indicated by the blue frame and the word "Ongoing" at the bottom-right corner). Contrary to immediate effects which apply once when you play the cards, or Harvest abilities for which you have to pay the cost each Harvest phase, ongoing abilities are always "on". You can take advantage of them as many times as they allow you to!

In this particular case, the Cabbages ask you to build Livestock cards around them. The more you build, the more Food they will generate! (and don't forget those nice 2 victory points at the end).
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Farming
mechanics: Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

"+1 Strength during your turn only. If you attack a Goblin Tribe, they discard 1 Secrets card. If you hit the Dragon, it discards 1 card. If you smash a Crystal, the Cave discards 1 Omen. If you kill the Thief, gain 2 extra Grit."

name: Kaosball: Team – Port Royale Pirates
description:
“The good things in life are free, but the best things used to be yours.”

-Coach Freeman

Hold on to your cash, the Port Royale Pirates have come to Kaosball! With their uncanny ability to loot an enemy player with every successful play, this team can cheat and bribe the ref with near impunity. Can anyone stand up to this combination of flourish and gleeful abuse of the rules?

mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Panzer Grenadier: Blue Division
description:
When Nazi armies launched their sneak attack on the Soviet Union in June 1941, Spanish fascists exulted. Still nursing deep hatreds from the Soviet role in the Spanish Civil War, thousands volunteered to fight alongside the Germans. Spanish dictator Francisco Franco organized them into a “Blue Division” to carry the fight to the Russians and, not coincidentally, send the most politically active fascists far away from Madrid.

Blue Division is a supplement to the Panzer Grenadier series, focusing on the actions of this unit between 1941 and 1943. Organized as a standard German infantry division, the Spanish unit fought well in some of the hardest fighting of the campaign. This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Eastern Front and Road to Berlin to play all of the scenarios.

All the new pieces represent Spanish volunteer forces: infantry, ski, engineer, motorcycle, bicycle and machine-gun troops; anti-tank guns, mortars and artillery, and of course leaders. Scenarios cover actions of these units between their arrival on the Eastern Front in October, 1941 and their departure almost exactly two years later.

Contents:
20 Scenarios
77 pieces

This game is part of the Panzer Grenadier series
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: First Axis: Slovakia at War 1939-1945 – A Panzer Grenadier Scenario Book
description:
From the publisher:

In March 1939, the small nation of Slovakia declared its independence from Czechoslovakia and immediately became a satellite of Nazi Germany. Slovak troops became the first Axis forces to fight alongside the Germans, joining in the invasion of Poland in September 1939. They also marched into the Soviet Union in 1941. After five years as the most minor of allies, the Slovaks turned against the fascists and fought with the victorious Allies in the last year of the war.

First Axis is a 64-page book supplement to the Panzer Grenadier series, focused on the battles of the Slovak Army against the Hungarians, Poles, Soviets and Germans. There are 30 new scenarios plus background articles on the armies and weapons involved and unit organization diagrams. This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Eastern Front: A Panzer Grenadier Game, Road to Berlin: Platoon Level Combat in World War II – A Panzer Grenadier Game and White Eagles: A Panzer Grenadier Supplement Book to enjoy all of the scenarios.

First Axis includes 88 die-cut and mounted playing pieces. Almost all of them represent Slovak forces, including the small country's surprisingly large array of tanks. There are also a few new Hungarian tank pieces included. The book's format is the same as our very popular White Eagles: A Panzer Grenadier Supplement Book and Fronte Russo: A Panzer Grenadier Expansion Book books.

This game is part of the Panzer Grenadier series

Expands:

Eastern Front: A Panzer Grenadier Game
Road to Berlin: Platoon Level Combat in World War II – A Panzer Grenadier Game
White Eagles: A Panzer Grenadier Supplement Book
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Phase Order

"On the northern edge of the Realm lies a valley inhabited by several belligerent goblin tribes. While they spend most of their time fighting against each other, they are also always ready to assault any settlers trying to establish a foothold in this land."

This official scenario for "Kingsburg" creates a second deck of Invaders called the Valley Deck. During each winter, if the top card of the Valley Deck turns out to be a Goblin card, it makes the Invader attack that much more powerful, and hurt even more.

name: Tinderblox Sunset
description:
Tinderblox Sunset puts players in a campfire setting in which each player attempts to keep the fire burning, but if you place the blocks badly, you risk burning down the camp!

Each turn, players draw a card from the campfire deck which instructs them to place a log, an ember, or any combination of them in various orientations on top of the campfire. Players use tweezers to "play with fire" and if you drop anything, you're considered a fire hazard and you're removed from the game. The player who is the most careful with fire wins!

Differences between Tinderblox Day, Night and Sunset:
Tinderblox Day is the original game.
Tinderblox Night is a limited edition version which includes more challenging cards.
Tinderblox Sunset includes the Marshmallow mini-expansion (otherwise sold separately) and is made from FSC-compliant materials.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Party Game
mechanics: Player Elimination, Stacking and Balancing

name: MetroX: Sendai & Hakata & Nagoya
description:
In MetroX, players create subway networks by filling in the station spaces on their individual game sheets. Using the numbers revealed by the cards, all players fill up their subway map with ◯s in the station spaces. However, the number of times they can add stations to each line is limited, so they have to make tough choices. Players can score many points by getting their star bonuses in stations with many intersecting routes. Players also get bonuses by being the first to complete routes. Try to fill in all your stations to minimize the penalties and achieve a high score!

MetroX: Sendai & Hakata & Nagoya includes three different maps to use with the rules in MetroX, along with new rules for branching and annular lines.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Number, Puzzle, Trains
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil

name: Dust Tactics: Operation "Cerberus"
description:
Massive combat walkers tread the streets, armored troops storm the buildings of Southern England, and Dust Tactics pushes deeper into urban warfare with the campaign expansion Operation "Cerberus", which features:


New rules for multilevel combat. Squads can move up and down floors of the structures they enter, gaining advantages as they fire against foes outside the walls. This campaign expansion comes with parts for a customizable three-dimensional building, allowing players to construct terrain up to three stories tall.
New skills for NCO Command Squads and heavy walkers.
Two new heroes: The Axis assassin, Angela, and the Chef, who fights with two flamethrowers.
A chronology of the alternate-reality World War II and profiles some of the war's greatest heroes.
Seven new scenarios.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

The machines will do everything in their power to prevent players from discovering these uncomfortable stories. Contrary to the main storyline, the adventures of Forbidden Chapter mostly take place in provinces and smaller villages, avoiding the neon lights of big cities.

This expansion includes:

a new type of hacking tokens

6 new Hunts
And more!

The Night is Darker explores a series of mysterious attacks on emergency medical facilities created to fight a rapidly spreading outbreak. The Order of Vampire Hunters encounters hordes of monsters and sends larger teams to clear out these infestations.

What is the source of the deadly contagion? What is attracting these swarms of Vampires? Is the Order ready for these greater challenges?
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board
publishers: Dark Gate Games LLC, DG Games Entertainment (Dark Gate Games)

name: Fallen Land: Descendants
description:
The fourth Installment for Fallen Land: A Post-Apocalyptic Board Game. It will include:


A large beautiful card box, wide enough for sleeving. Cards will sit upright.
Ten cardboard dividers for separating the decks
Two small chip organizers (for Damage chips, Salvage Coins etc...).
One large chip organizer (for Town Technologies, Week Penalty Chips and Town Defense chips).
New Town Events Deck.
Ten Alternative Faction Town Play Mats.
The Solo Variant III.
The Campaign Variants I & II.
New Optional and Advanced Rules.
New twenty piece Salvage Coins
A New Town Technology.
Other NEW chips.
New Cards for ALL seven original decks of cards.


And tons of other goodies.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Space Explorers: Age of Ambition
description:
In the Age of Ambition expansion, you discover new frontiers of the Golden Era of Astronautics.

Defend the interests of your Space Power. Enlist the support of influential politicians, powerful military leaders, and renowned scientists. Overcome crises and reach your strategic goals. Launch cutting-edge spacecraft and achieve breakthroughs in research. Manage it all using your own unique talents to carry out the most daring plans.

The glorious history of space exploration unfolds over the 7 separate Modules. You add them to the game in any combination, using up to 3 Modules at a time. Each Module perfectly fits the others and creates new gaming experiences.

Solo rulebook is also included and is compatible with the new modules.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Space Exploration
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection
publishers: 25th Century Games, CrowD Games, Moroz Dev Studio

name: Skulls of Sedlec: Holiday Features
description:
Two new Christmas themed features on 1 double-sided card to add to your solo games!


Christmas Tree
Bell


Requires Skulls of Sedlec and Monstrance expansion to play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Galaxy Hunters: New Ways to Hunt
description:
Expand your arsenal and abilities with the New Ways to Hunt Expansion. Choose from several new mechanics to enhance your experience:

Push your luck and take on the mightiest of mutants with Combat Dice. Obliterate your target with critical hits, or miss wildly in your vain attempt at glory.
Hunt with up to five players.
Outsmart your fellow mercenaries and disperse Ambassadors throughout the system, gaining resources on their move.
The Iron Smoker mech, and new Pilot Duar Krill Join in the hunt, ready to spread notoriety, throughout the system.


Choose any of these mechanics at the start of each game. Outwit, outmanoeuvre, and annihilate your foes with News Ways to Hunt.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Daqan Infantry Command – Unit Upgrade Expansion
description:
Description from the publisher:

With polished armor glinting in the sunlight, the armies of the twelve baronies and the Free Cities are a stirring sight. Master wizards from the circles at Greyhaven and Nerekhall bolster their ranks, wielding destructive power and an arsenal of runebound shards to devastate their foes. Battle standards with histories as long as the Baronies of Daqan swirl in the wind, while the roar of lion horns stiffens the backs of wavering soldiers. Every company is led by a champion, one who has faced death time and again, yet has survived and now invites others to draw strength from his own stolid bravery.

The Daqan Infantry Command Unit Upgrade Expansion introduces four brand-new figures to the armies of the Daqan Lords—a Banner Guard, a Wizard, a Champion, and a Cornicen. Alongside these figures, you’ll find eighteen new upgrade cards, many of which include ways to bring these new figures into your armies. For instance, you may choose to support one of your units with the Lance Corporal upgrade card, implanting the Champion figure into the ranks of your unit. As long as the Champion figure is alive, you gain the benefit of the Lance Corporal card, which significantly boosts your tactical flexibility!
categories: Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Waste Knights: Second Edition – Tales From The Outback
description:
The Waste is in turmoil. New challenges arise as old technologies, strange cults and pre-Scourge secrets return to haunt the survivors of the apocalypse. From the war-torn west to the struggling east, the inhabitants of ruined Australia are longing for a moment of respite.

Will you be the one to grant it? Will you face the unknown threats to prove human superiority? Or maybe you will seize the opportunity and grab what you can before everything goes to hell? Time to prove your mettle against fearsome enemies and impossible dangers. Time to show everyone that your deserve to be called a Waste Knight!

INSIDE THE BOX:


4 new Knights (Reverend Evans (Priest), Frank Strzelecki (Judge), Lisa Gomez (Scout), Warragul (Mercenary) with accompanying components (miniatures, sheets and upgrade cards)
4 new Vehicles to get you exactly where you want to go
The Guide and the Book of Tales featuring 4 new adventures, from co-op ones such as Rise of the Red Lord to competitive race found in Deadly Cargo along with their special cards, tokens and markers
New rules featuring Landmarks for even better immersion in the setting, Parts enabling you to pimp up your ride, and City Tasks that provide you with more open-world gameplay
New Wasteland Cards, tokens and markers for more variety whenever you ride out to the Waste


—description from publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Rolling Realms: Parks Promo Pack
description:
Expand your copy of Rolling Realms with this set of 6 promo cards, inspired by Parks.

In this realm, you’re hiking down three trails from left to right. Use your dice to mark sites on the trail and gain benefits. To complete this realm, you must visit all 6 sites with a star.

-description from developer
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Legends Untold: The Druid Novice Booster
description:
The Druiach Path guides those who seek to become one with nature upon Mor Nadar. It allows the Neophytes that follow its ways to draw on the powers of the animals, insects and reptiles found deep within the Weeping Caves and Great Sewers of Dun Mordhain.

The Druid Pack gives you the first steps along the path to become a true Druid of Mor Nadar. Gain a companion and make use of the fauna within the environment to succeed on your adventures with Legends Untold.

Four extra cards are attached to the back of the Druid Booster to as errated cards.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Jagged Alliance: The Board Game – Underground!
description:
Adds the JA2 "SCI-Fi" Mode to the game, with a new dictator, the infamous Crepitus (8 new enemy minis), extra underground sectors and high-tech weaponry.
Fully compatible with Base Game Campaign
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order

name: DBM Army Lists Book 2: 500 BC to 476 AD
description:
This book includes 84 armies from all around the world to use with the DBM rules.
Each list is designed to produce 300 AP to 500 AP armies which closely simulate their real life prototype, while still allowing sufficient flexibility to cover historical variations during the period and legitimate differences of opinion or personal preference.
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Black Rose Wars: Rebirth – Dread Forge
description: The Lodge Forge has been lighted again and an ancient threat has been awakened. A new opponent is making his way through the ravaged rooms of the Lodge, and a hell of magma and flames is about to break loose! This rich expansion adds Magma, a huge new Avatar, The new cyclopic Mage Etna, and the new Forge School of Magic to your games!
categories: Unspecified
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: Czacha Games, Hobby World, Intrafin Games, Ludus Magnus Studio, Pegasus Spiele

name: The Lost Cause: Expansion Kit
description:
The Curtain Falls: 1865

States of Siege #4 Expansion Kit

The War of the Rebellion continued after the Election fo 1864, and with this expansion kit for The Lost Cause so too does this game. With additional Confederate Resources and Leaders (including "Stonewall" Jackson and Longstreet), plus cards that extend the game into 1865 and enhance the narrative with several new Broadsheet events, you'll be whistling Dixie in no time!

Note, The Lost Cause Expansion Kit is not a ‘stand alone’ game. You must own a copy of The Lost Cause to use this expansion kit.

Game Data:
Complexity: 4 (Basic Game) or 4.5 (Advanced Game) on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 9 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each unit is one Union Army or Civil War Leader, and each turn is one month

Game Components:
• One 2-page, color Optional Rules sheet
• 8 color, die-cut 5/8” mounted game pieces
• 12 (total) ‘Headline’ and 'Broadsheet' cards

Credits:

Game Design: Hans von Stockhausen
Documentation & Development: Alan Emrich
Playtesting: Chris Dorrell, David Ells, Mark Herman
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Steam Torpedo: First Contact – To Your Positions!
description:
Description from the publisher:

Steam Torpedo: First Contact - To Your Positions! is a non-collectible booster pack for the tactical submarine battle game Steam Torpedo that includes seven new submarine compartment tiles and three new crew members, thereby allowing players to build new submarines and create new strategies.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Nautical, World War I
mechanics: Modular Board, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Munchkin Zombies: The Walking Dead
description: Level up in this apocalyptic world as the Walkers aim to have their revenge against the survivors. Munchkin Zombies: The Walking Dead is a 56-card expansion for Steve Jackson's Munchkin Zombies stand-alone game.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Humor, Zombies
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Steve Jackson Games, The Op Games

name: Tao Long: The Way of the Dragon – The Tiger and the Phoenix
description:
Tao Long: The Tiger and the Phoenix expansion replaces the earth dragon with a 3-tile tiger and a 1-tile phoenix. The phoenix starts off the board, so the earth / tiger-and-phoenix player starts with ¾ the length of the heaven dragon. The tiger is otherwise the same as the earth dragon, except that it can only expel water.

The phoenix functions like a single-tile dragon that can only repel fire, and whose damage removes fire stones.

The phoenix comes into play once the player's fire meter has at least 1 stone, by appearing adjacent to the tiger. If the player's fire meter becomes empty, the phoenix leaves the board again. As one might expect, each time the fire meter starts to fill, the phoenix rises again.

While the phoenix is on the board, the tiger-and-pheonix player gets to move both creatures, in any order.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Grid Movement

name: Eminent Domain: Elusive/Exclusive Victory Promo
description:
Double sided promo technology card given out to Kickstarters of the 1st Edition as a bonus for the delay on production.

Elusive Victory
Permanent Technology
Research Cost: 12
Planets Required: Utopian and Prestige
Prestige Points: Infinite
Effect: You win the game. No exceptions, not even for family.

Exclusive Victory
Permanent Technology
Research Cost: 5
Planets Required: None
Prestige Points: 0
Effect: If the game ends in a tie, you win the game. (Even if you're not one of the tied players)
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Phase Order

name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Unstable Kismet Promo Card
description: Unstable Kismet is a promo card that was sold to celebrate the release of Shattered Timelines / Wrath of the Cosmos combined box. The oversized version is available as part of the Sentinels of the Multiverse: Villain Oversized Cards.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Wars: Legion – Clone Captain Rex Commander Expansion
description:
Clone Captain Rex viewed military service as an honor, and his loyalty to the Republic and his Jedi Generals was absolute. Rex honed the use of twin blaster pistols into an art form, leading his fellow clones to victory on countless battlefields across the galaxy.

The Clone Captain Rex Commander Expansion contains everything you need to add this new commander to your Galactic Republic army, including an unpainted Clone Captain Rex miniature that can be assembled without his helmet, or with either a Phase I or Phase II Clone Trooper helmet. This miniature comes with Rex's three signature command cards that give him the power to issue orders to his fellow clone troopers, as well as five upgrade cards inviting you to unlock Rex's full potential.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – The Shifting Sands Asylum Pack
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Shifting Sands is the first Asylum Pack in the Ancient Relics cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game. The Great Old Ones' reach extends worldwide in this debut pack, which alone in this cycle features 12 new story cards. The Shifting Sands strikes out in a bold new direction, moving Call of Cthulhu's action away from the darkened mansions of Arkham and onto the burning sands of Egypt. Learn what evil lurks in the cursed tomb beneath the pyramids!

Investigators and Cultists confront each other - and sometimes work together - beneath the shadows of the great pyramids, in The Shifting Sands. In this Asylum Pack you will meet diverse agents from each of Call of Cthulhu's factions. The Shifting Sands also features a number of new Relic support cards: ancient and powerful tools that will aid your faction's takeover of the world for the Ancient Ones or guard against them.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Villagers & Villains: The Borderlands
description:
Villagers & Villains: The Borderlands, the first expansion for the V&V base game, includes 22 cards that can be shuffled into the standard deck. These cards add mechanisms and capacities previously unavailable in the game, including the ability to bring discarded cards back into the game, some mild "take that" elements to affect other towns, double pairs, and challenges with benefits to your town. Each new card is unique and provides some dimension not yet seen in the base game.

BUILDING (5)- King's Court, Shanty, Stable, Toll Bridge, Training Ground
CITIZEN (6)- Archaeologist, Caravan Trader, Children, Gambler, Gravedigger, Recruiter
CHALLENGE (7) - Bureaucrat, Casino, Disease, Flirt, Hustler, Necromancer, Wanted Men
HERO (4)- Battle Cleric, General, Monk, Squire
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Nightvault – Steelheart’s Champions
description:
The warriors under the command of Liberator-Prime Severin Steelheart were part of a detachment sent to investigate potential cures for the curse that robs them of their humanity with each reforging. Disaster befell them, however, and now they are trapped, separated from their kin, with only the whispers of the dead to guide them home...

Introduce Steelheart’s Champions – a Stormcast Eternals warband previously available in the Warhammer Underworlds: Shadespire boxed game – to your games of Warhammer Underworlds: Nightvault and take advantage of new and different ways to play – whatever warband you use – with this set of miniatures and cards. It includes 3 Stormcast Eternals miniatures and a deck of 60 cards, 31 of which are universal to be used by any and every warband – add these cards to your arsenal and build your perfect deck.

Included:


3 Easy to Build, blue-coloured plastic Stormcast Eternals miniatures: Severin Steelheart, Obryn the Bold, Angharad Brightshield;
60 unique cards for use in games of Warhammer Underworlds: Nightvault, broken down as follows:
9 objective cards for Steelheart’s Champions;
10 upgrade cards for Steelheart’s Champions;
10 ploys for Steelheart’s Champions;
11 universal objectives, for use with any Warhammer Underworlds warband;
10 universal upgrades, for use with any Warhammer Underworlds warband;
10 universal ploys, for use with any Warhammer Underworlds warband.


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Kami-sama: Spirit Way
description:
The thrill of the hunt... a winter's chill... the dreams we have... and even the radishes we enjoy. Each of these forces affect the world around us and are in fact personified by a spirit. These Kami work together to form the natural order of things, but each aspires for influence over those that worship them.

Kami-sama is a beautiful and intuitive strategy game set in rural Japan during the Edo period. You assume the role of one of the many Kami, the spirits of the land. Using a combination of asymmetrical powers, area control, set collection, pattern building, and light card drafting, you will work to balance your Favor with the people and your connection to Nature in order to be crowned Kami-sama, the chief deity of the land.

Kami-sama: Spirit Way contains expansion content for Kami-Sama. Featuring 4 all new Kami, and introducing 4 Merchant Villager cards to add to your game! Spirit Way requires Kami-sama to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Enchanters: Event Deck
description:
What’s in the Event Deck? With this mini-expansion, you can never be sure what will happen next, as strings of fate twist and turn! For each player, you will add 3 Event cards into the adventure deck. When drawn, they either fire off some wild effect or attach themselves to other cards and influence the game, while that card is in play.
—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Apocrypha Adventure Card Game: Box Two – The Flesh
description:
THE FLESH IS WILLING.

Rotting creatures pouring out from an oil well. Faeries on motorcycles and carnival rides. Flying drones marshalled by a monster made of clay and wires. Flesh-eating bacteria worming its way into your nervous system. Just another day on the edge of the apocalypse.

The Flesh is an expansion for the Apocrypha Adventure Card Game that can be played as a co-op card game for 1-6 players or a full roleplaying game with one player acting as a guide.

The Flesh contains four chapters, each containing cards that detail memories written by a legendary author. This box contains:

The Book of the Deathless, in which an oil town in frozen Alberta is invaded by the risen dead, with memories by Bruce R. Cordell.
The Book of the Fae, in which the faeries and bikers of the Wild Hunt roar across the American Midwest, with memories by Jerry “Tycho” Holkins.
The Book of the Golems, in which the tech hub of Seattle is overrun with drones and robots, with memories by Teeuwynn Woodruff.
The Book of the Physicians, in which the eastern seaboard is the test market for virulent designer diseases, with memories by Kris Straub.


—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Die Zwerge: Albae Expansion
description:
User Summary
This small 10-card expansion is meant for all players of "Die Zwerge" who already have completed the game on the "Hero" difficulty level as well as all other players who like a challenge.

The expansion contains 1 new scenario card, 1 adventure card, 5 threat cards and 2 equipment cards as well as a rules card that explains how to combine the expansion with the base game.

This expansion is also included in the Collectors edition of the base game and in the English edition of the the Combined Might expansion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Fully Loaded Devices Pack
description:
Set the timer and brace for detonation! The Fully Loaded Devices Pack collects numerous devices for X-Wing, giving you access to a vast arsenal of options for your squadrons. In addition to the upgrade cards and tokens for Proximity Mines, Conner Nets, Ion Bombs, and more, this devices pack contains six environment cards that use devices as part of setup. With these cards, you can battle in deadly minefields, fly your ships through star fields riddled with unexploded ordnance, or even maneuver to avoid continuous bombardments!

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: High Frontier Interstellar
description:
High Frontier Interstellar is a solitaire expansion to High Frontier Colonization that allows players to travel out of our solar system to the stars beyond. It can be played independently or as an extension of a standard (Colonization) game.

To play you need all of the following:

High Frontier
High Frontier Colonization
The free Interstellar rules available from Sierra Madre Games
The Interstellar Map available on Zazzle.
categories: Civilization, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Transportation
mechanics: Simulation

name: Evil Dead 2: The Board Game – Extras Pack
description:
The extras pack includes enemy figures and accompanying event cards that allow you to summon possessed wildlife (deer & squirrels) and demon minions (along with Bad Ash & Gooseneck Henrietta bosses) to challenge the heroes and aid the Deadites! Also included are the following items: Axes, Chainsaw, Shotguns, Kandarian Dagger and Barricades.

Use this expansion to face the cabin in an even deadlier encounter with bigger dangers and badder enemies. Can you survive another night battling the Evil Dead?
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Action Points, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Broken Peace (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description: A print and play expansion for T.I.M.E Stories. The scenario takes place at the Peace Conference after WWI in Paris, France.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Storytelling

name: Star Fleet Battles: Module S2 – Scenario Book #2
description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

From the back of the cover:

Ten General Scenarios: Rebel Reduction, Race to the Base, Graveyard of Ships, Black Hole Mania, and five more. Plus the solitaire adventure Maw of Charybdis.

Thirty-seven Historical Scenarios: Internal Disorder, Tug of War, Rescue the Supply Tug, First Sing of the Hornets, Pirate Stew, Tricked!, Faulty Logic, Desperate Days, A Double Surprise, Long Shot, Center of Attention, Tortoise and the Hares, Operation Achilles, Circle the Echelon, The Last Fling, and nineteen more! Plus, the three-scenario mini-campaign Kroal's Illegitimate War!

Three Monster Scenarios: Ice Monster, Metamorph, and the space dragon Mating Frenzy!

Two new campaigns: LDR Commander (three new scenarios), and Survey Cruiser Captain!

Special Bonuses: Asteroid Field Map in stunning full color! Prime Teams in SFB!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Days of Villainy
description:
In March of 2011, Libyans in opposition to Colonel Muammar Gaddafi and his government took up arms. For eight months, the opposition, fighting under an interim governing body, the National Transitional Council (NTC), fought Colonel Gaddafi’s Loyalist forces all across the country. In October, during a fierce battle in the coastal city of Sirte, Gaddafi was captured and killed.

Days of Villainy is an expansion that can be played with ANY core/base games of the Lock 'n Load Tactical series. Days of Villainy depicts four of the fierce battles that occurred during the Libyan Civil War, including Colonel Gaddafi’s final epic confrontation. Both sides are loaded for bear, armed with RPG-7s and FN MAG and PKM machine guns. The Loyalists have the armored support of BTR-60s and T-55s, but the NTC rebels have plenty of well-armed Technicals to drive into battle, as well as KPV heavy machine guns and the aid of seasoned fighters from the Katiba Tiger and Al-Saiqa commando brigades.

Scenarios Include:

• Hold or Die: An armored column of Loyalist forces attempted to retake the vital oil hub of Marsa al-Brega, on the road to Benghazi. A tough fight was ahead of them, and the sun was setting.

• On the Road to Sirte: A convoy of NTC rebels and Al-Saiqa commandos tasked with delivering ammunition to Harawa was ambushed by a small force of Loyalists. Despite the initial blasts of roadside mines, the remnants of the convoy had to push through.

• Assault on Bab Al-Aziziya: In late August, NTC rebels entered Tripoli. Many neighborhoods were easily taken, but the Bab Al Aziziya compound, symbol of Gaddafi’s contemptible regime, was still intact. The compound had become a fortress that had to be taken.

• Game Over: On October 20th, 2011, an American Predator drone identified a Loyalist convoy leaving the city of the pro-Gaddafi stronghold of Sirte. The drone and French aircraft in the area attacked the convoy, and NTC rebels in the sector closed in on the commotion. Little did they know that Gaddafi was a passenger in the convoy. The stage was set for a vicious, climactic battle.

UPDATE: All of our manuals and guides can be Downloaded, Viewed, and even printed right from our LnLP Online Library: We now have an Online Library of all, well almost all of our manuals. We add some every few weeks. You can find all the LnLT manuals at the link below.

LnLP Online Library: http://library.lnlpublishing.com/

Lock ʼn Load Tactical: Days of Villainy is an expansion that can be played with ANY complete Lock ʼn Load module.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Bohnanza: Spiderbeans
description:
Expansion for Bohnanza only available with the book "Das grosse Bohnanza Buch" and distributed at the Amigo booth at SPIEL 2015.
It adds 6 new cards to the game. Three of the Spiderbeans are orange, three are black. With this comes a new way of bluffing when you're trading the Spiderbeans.
When you harvest the SpiderBeans it's not just the number of beans that counts but more the way you planted them.

Expands:

Bohnanza
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Negotiation
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Trading

name: Zendo: Rules Expansion #1
description: Zendo: Rules Expansion #1 consists of ten new rule cards for use with the Zendo base game: one rated as Easy, four as Medium, and five as Difficult. These cards generate 52 different rules, but don't look through the new rules ahead of time as you want to figure them out for yourself as you play the game!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Ruins (fan expansion for 7 Wonders)
description:
"The human lot is to always choose the lesser of two evils."
- Aristotle

With Ruins, your civilizations are on the decline. Will you restore your previous glory or will people come and visit your city for its ruins? With this expansion, enjoy a new type of gameplay and adapt your strategy. Will you take advantage of the decline of your enemies while rebuilding your empire?

The Ruins work similar to Leaders. Players will draft 4 Ruins cards at the beginning of the game. Each player than immediately puts 3 Ruin cards into play at the beginning of the game before any other cards are played. The Ruins give each player more difficulties to overcome while building their Wonder. Some Ruin cards have some penalties for building a certain color structures, a certain symbol, or a certain configuration of cards. Some constructions will cost more, some buildings will be destroyed, but greatness can rise from the Ruins.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Cerberus: Treasures of the Underworld
description: An expansion with new board and cards for Cerberus.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology, Negotiation
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Negotiation

name: Spearpoint 1943: Village and Defensive Line Map Expansion
description:
Expand your copy of Spearpoint 1943 and Spearpoint 1943 Eastern Front with Frontline General: Spearpoint 1943 Village and Defensive Line Map Expansion! This expansion requires the cards from either base game of Spearpoint 1943 and adds new depth to the system, new situations with fictional intros by Mark H. Walker, beautiful Marc von Martial artwork, large die-cut 1" general counters and 4" terrain tiles, printed rules/situation booklet, quick reference and score cards, and a gorgeous two-sided mounted 12"x36" Village / Defensive Line map inspired by 1943 Italian summer and winter terrain.

Features


Take the fast-paced fun of the original two-player 30-minute World War II squad-level tactical card game Spearpoint 1943 to a whole new level!
Play new tense tactical Standard Games and Situations that set up differently every time using versatile die-cut terrain tiles such as buildings, ruins, minefields, bunkers, trenches, and more!
Expansion includes new Situations with fictional introductions by Mark H. Walker.
Beautiful Marc von Martial (cogwheeldesigns.com) component and box artwork.
Adds simple new rules to the Spearpoint 1943 system including movement, line of sight, combat within buildings and structures, artillery spotting, and more!
Adds more tactical challenges for players through new well-tested Situations.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

Improve and complete your team to crush the competition by collecting more cards and dice in foil packs and other sets!

Each DC Dice Masters: World Finest Collector’s Box contains:

20 custom dice
1 felt dice bag
10 Basic Action Cards

2 dice storage trays that hold over 300 dice

This card can be mixed with any of the other hero cards in the game to give players one more choice when choosing heroes before starting to play.

As with every other hero, Kid Flash grants a special ability to the player, which in this case is: "Whenever you buy or gain a card, you may add the top card of the main deck to the Line-Up."

Sail and fight with HMS Victory, Lord Nelson's flagship at Trafalger, the most famous First=rate ship-of-the-line in the Royal Navy.

This Sails of Glory Ship Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, compatible with other Sails of Glory-Napoleonic Wars game product.

name: Habitats: Double Expansion
description:
This 12 tiles expansion contains 6 special park tiles and 6 new goal tiles.


The 6 DOUBLE LANDSCAPE park tiles don't bring victory points themselves, but contain 2 landscape types to connect to each adjacent tile.


This makes it even possible to cross landscape type areas, to fulfill the demands of your animals better.

The 6 goal tiles add variety to the YEARLY GOALS. It brings you more victory points if you beat your opponents by:
Getting a good variation in animal types.
Meeting other rangers in the market.
Pleasing your visitors with watchtowers, routes and views.
Creating the most mysterious secret spot.
Building spots where animals/visitors can move in each direction.
Being close to a market corner.



—description from the designer

name: Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters: Space Wolves – Sons of Russ Team Pack
description:
Set in the dark sci-fantasy world of Warhammer 40,000, Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters allows players to build teams of iconic characters and warriors to battle it out for supremacy using custom dice and cards. Warhammer 40,000 Dice Masters uses the game system designed by Mike Elliott and Eric M. Lang for Dice Masters and is completely compatible with other games in the line. Four factions are available when the series first launches, and players can either build teams using a single faction or mix and match to create their own Dice Masters team.

The Space Wolves – Sons of Russ Team Pack introduces Logan Grimnar and the Venerable Dreadnought at the front of a Space Wolves Space Marine force.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Siege of Runedar: Mercenaries Promo Cards
description:
This promo was first given out to everybody whom bought The Siege of Runedar at Spiel 2021 in Essen.

It adds 5 mercenary cards to the 5 from the base game and therefore will give you more possibilities to defend the castle.

The abilities of these new mercenaries are: ignore all orc cards in your hand, remove up to 5 rubble pieces from the tunnel, place all remaining resources on an upgrade card, do a long-range attack with 5 dice & do a close-range attack with 5 dice.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Decks: The Black Riders
description:
The Riders halted, but Frodo had not the power of Bombadil. His enemies laughed at him with a harsh and chilling laughter. "Come back! Come back!" they called. "To Mordor we will take you!"
–J.R.R. Tolkien, The Fellowship of the Ring

Come back to The Black Riders with The Black Riders Nightmare Decks for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game, but this time, the Nazgûl you'll face are deadlier and more persistant than ever!

Combined in one single package, you'll find three twenty-card Nightmare Decks, one for each of the three scenarios from The Black Riders Saga Expansion. These Nightmare Decks introduce new setup and encounter decks that greatly increase the difficulty of the scenarios they modify, even as they explore new themes and characters, such as the game's second named Nazgûl, Khamûl the Easterling!

The Nazgûl feature prominently through these Nightmare Decks, even as they are accompanied by other cards that force you into difficult decisions as doom closes in upon you. Moreover, if you're playing through the scenarios in Campaign Mode, your decisions can haunt you throughout the whole duration of your journey to Mount Doom, as The Black Riders Nightmare Decks also kicks off your Nightmare Mode The Lord of the Rings campaign. The chances are greater than ever that your Ring-bearer will truly feel the weight and burden of the One Ring!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Galakta

name: Song of Deeds and Glory
description:
Song of Deeds and Glory is an expansion for the popular Song of Blades and Heroes miniatures rules. It features all the rules and guidelines needed to run extended campaigns, taking warriors from green recruits to grizzled veterans. Now players can send their warbands on the path to conquest and carve out their own territories!

This book includes rules such as:

Territories: own land, defend it from usurpers, or launch raids on your neighbors.

Scenarios: a multitude of new combat situations.

The aftermath of battle: will your heroes live or be horribly crippled?

Exploration: find strange and useful treasure and visit exotic, dangerous locales.

Shopping: use your warband's hard-earned gold to purchase the finest gear or hire the services of experts.

Development: watch your characters grow as they survive new battles. Boost their stats, train them in new skills, or send them on personal quests.

Special rules: 15 exciting new powers such as Immortal, Enchanter, and Illusionist.

Rosters: 36 new creatures such as the Minotaur Skeleton, the Dwarf Gunner, Insectoids, Automatons, and the powerful Kryxxtendrella, Queen of Dragons!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Meditation and Mastery
description:
From the publisher:

Throughout the Opposition cycle, the rivalries and feuds between affiliations dominate the game. The Jedi against the Sith. The Rebellion against the Galactic Empire. The galaxy’s scum and villainy against the loyal smugglers and spies. Now, with the third Force Pack in the cycle, you’ll have the chance to choose your side and battle to decide the fate of the galaxy.

Meditation and Mastery is the third Force Pack in the Opposition cycle for Star Wars: The Card Game, and this expansion offers ten new objective sets (two copies each of five distinct sets), granting new options to every affiliation. Here, you’ll find new affiliated fate cards for the Rebel Alliance and the Imperial Navy, alongside some of the other new fate cards introduced in this cycle. You’ll also gain the opportunity to fly and fight alongside recognizable characters from the Star Wars saga, including Wedge Antilles, Nien Nunb, and Admiral Screed.

Contains objective sets 241-245.

description:
The Themed AI Deck expansion for Hellenica: Story of Greece expands the solo and AI playability of Hellenica by adding AI decks unique to each city-state. In the basic game, all city-states use the same AI deck.

Using the Themed AI DEck expansion, each city-state will be more likely to follow its historical path. Thus, Sparta will tend to focus on land power, Athens will tend to want to control the seas, etc.

Expand your Hellenica: Story of Greece experience using the Themed AI Deck expansion.

name: Rattus Cartus: Nobilis
description:
1348, Europe – The Black Death ravages Europe, and your country still has no king after the last one was killed by the plague. The nobility of the land has had enough of you princes never being able to settle for an heir for the country. Therefore, the nobles have begun to interfere with your disputes. On your visits to the various buildings, it may now occur that you meet a noble with a political agenda of his own. In some cases, he welcomes you and helps you in your quest, while in other cases he tries to make life as difficult as possible for you. Will you be able to keep the nobles at your side in your struggles against the other princes so that at last a new, worthy king can be elected?

Rattus Cartus: Nobilis, the first expansion for Rattus Cartus (a card game based on the Rattus board game) includes 18 different buildings with players using all or only some of them each game to provide a wide variety of play. This first expansion also includes special cards (Books, Horses, Lances, Privilegs, Wizard Staffs and Diplomats) and extra rat tokens; a second module in this expansion includes noble tokens.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Meeple Circus: Tomatoes and Awards
description:
TOMATOES: During the third round, before each act, one player (other that the one who is performing their act) is designated as the tomatoes thrower.

That player takes 5 Tomato tokens from the reserve.

As soon as the performance starts, the tomatoes thrower will throw tomatoes at the performing player (making sure not to disturb the performance) in three different cases:


anytime one or more components fall
anytime you hear a big cymbal crash (after 1 minute, and then every 20 seconds).
if the performing player forgets to say "tadaaaa" at the end of their act.


Note: A player cannot get more than 5 tomatoes during an act. At the end of the game, the player (or players) who got the most tomatoes loses 3 Applause, and the player (or players) who got the fewest tomatoes gains 3 Applause!

AWARDS: At the beginning of the game, each player takes an Award token from the reserve.

Before the game ends, each player must have given their token to another player (at any time) and must explain why they did it. Examples: because that was the most amazing performance of the game, because this is a perfect execution of a challenge, because it was the funniest act.

At the end of the game, each Award token is worth 2 Applause.

If a player forgot (or did not want) to give their Award token, they lose 4 Applause.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck

name: Agra: Mini Expansion 1
description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo. Day 23

Consists of new building bonus tiles and new favour tiles.

Building Bonus Tiles:
During setup: Sort the Building Bonus tiles into two piles: those that give Guild influence, and those that do not. Randomly select two "influence" tiles for each building level and place these on the game board, making sure that each Guild is represented by at least 1 tile. Fill the remaining spaces with "non-influence" tiles.

Thus, each building level should have 2 Building Bonus tiles that give Guild influence, and 2 that do not.

New Favour tiles:
Includes 11 different tiles.

description: Raid and Pillage your foes with the Moon Clan a new clan deck for Crystal Clans. Moon Clan demoralizes its enemies by raiding their resources and invading their home zone. Muster an army of the dead with the Sunken Crew and their pirate ship the Risen Annabelle. Sneak past your opponent’s squads with the monstrous Deep Ones' Submerge ability. name: Heroes of Normandie: Guardians' Chronicles Expansion Pack
description:
Heroes of Normandy opened the liberation paths of Europe. This has been made possible with strong and powerful icons, going beyond what the simple man could do.

These men and women have become something greater. They have become superheroes!

Fast, agile, endowed with extraordinary faculties, with mythical equipment or advanced technology.

Send Captain Justice, the Super Yankee, at the front. He will stand in the front line of German armies, equipped with its only strength and patriotism. Meanwhile, Lady Britain will illuminate the dark sky with mighty lightnings.

The Allies were not the only ones to have their superheroes! The Reich has his own figurehead facing the opposing titans. Animal rage accompanies her and bloodlust is her reason for living. Her opponents are her next meal. A dark she-wolf gets in the way of these superheroes. She will leave them no chance, and if they ever manage to escape, her pack of werewolves will track them … Evil Anja is the mother of the pack.

Superheroes will have access to a new type of recruitment option: the superpowers! Instead of suffering hits, they can decide to lose superpower.

name: BattleTech: Master Rules
description:
From the back of the book:

THE FUTURE OF WARFARE IS HERE!

Welcome to the 31st century, a time of endless wars that rage across the known universe. These epic conflicts are won and lost by BattleMechs, 30-foot-tall, humanoid titans of metal bristling with high-intensity lasers, rapid-fire autocannon and dozens of other lethal weapons; enough firepower to level entire city blocks. Your elite force of MechWarriors drive these juggernauts into battle, blasting at your opponent's 'Mechs in a deadly game of kill or be killed. Will they become instant legends, or forgotten casualties? Only your skill and luck will determine their fate.

Drawing on years of experience, this book combines the best of the BattleTech board game into a unified whole. BattleTech Master Rules is entirely restructured and streamlined; it is the same game, but like you've never seen it before. This book includes the complete game rules, a quick-and-easy scenario creation system, the Battle Value point system for evaluating 'Mechs and balancing forces, and revised and expanded miniatures rules.

User comment:

This was the default, complete ruleset for BattleTech at the time of printing, superceding the earlier BattleTech Compendium: Rules of Warfare. Again, no rules were included for AeroTech or BattleSpace units; this ruleset was dedicated to ground-based combat.

These rules were revised and re-issued several times. The original FASA edition was published in 1998, and was then substantially updated and re-issued as the FASA Revised edition in 2001, one of the last BattleTech sourcebooks produced by FASA.

In 2002, the BattleTech license was taken over by FanPro, and in 2003 they revised the Master Rules and reossued them as the Classic BattleTech Master Rules, Revised in a softback format, followed by a hardback edition in 2004.

The BattleTech: Master Rules were finally superceded when Fanpro released the first edition of Classic BattleTech: Total Warfare in 2006.

mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles – Lawful Familiars
description:
The world of Sword & Sorcery is imbued with many mystical secrets, and familiars are but one of these! In this set players can find five intelligent little creatures that are able to create a magical link with their humanoid friends.

The ancient scrolls of the Archmagi classify Lawful familiars into three types, each characterized by a deep bond with their owner: Domestic (Dog); Wild (Boar, Horned Lizard, Owl); Legendary (Pixie).

Each of these Familiars provides valuable help on the battlefield or grants peculiar abilities to its owner, such as the superior sense of smell of a Dog or mystic enchantments of a Pixie. But this deep bond has a downside. When a Familiar dies, its owner suffers a terrible mental shock, which hampers their skills for a time.

This expansion can be used with any Sword & Sorcery Quest or Campaign (Immortal Souls or Ancient Chronicles), by simply shuffling the Familiar cards into the Treasure deck.
