name: 8Bit Box: Outspeed
description:
Using your controller, choose the route you’ll take for the next leg of the race. There are many possible strategies, and you’ll need to be cunning to be the first across the finish line. Managing your fuel level, accelerating at just the right time, and hindering your opponents will be the keys to success. Be in the lead at the end of the final tile to be declared the winner!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Queue, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Teotihuacan: City of Gods – Man vs Meeple Promo
description:
This promo adds a new Royal tile to the game.

When worshiping here, gain 2 victory points for each of your workers currently locked into worship locations (including this one).

In 2020, became available as part of the Teotihuacan: City of Gods – Promo Bundle
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Movement, Point to Point Movement, Rondel, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Consumption: Extra Helpings
description:
Consumption: Extra Helpings comprises all the stretch goals that were unlocked during the initial funding campaign for Consumption: Food and Choice.

Adding additional recipes and 4 unique modules to enhance the core game, Extra Helpings is sure to keep bringing you back to the table.

—description from the back of the box

This expansion adds the following:

Expansion Recipes: 15 recipe cards with teal photo borders that can be included in any play mode.
Potluck Module: 8 recipe cards with yellow photo borders, not suitable for solitaire play.
Goals Module: 10 goal cards to award the two players who best meet the tasks defined thereupon.
Food Allergy Module: 4 food allergy tiles to cover 4 food groups, requiring each player to work around a food allergy.
Freezer Module: 4 little freezer boards to allow players to freeze meats, so they can save them until they want to use them.


—user summary
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Heroes Incorporated: S.U.P.E.R. (Scrap's Upgrade Pack and Expansion Revision)
description:
S.U.P.E.R. is the first expansion pack to Heroes Incorporated, the super-powered hero boardgame where Crime Fighting DOES pay! Scrap's Upgrade Pack and Expansion Revison not only features new components to increase the fun, but it also enhances existing bits from the core game.

Contents:


5 New HEROES with unique powers
7 additional GADGETS including the introduction of very powerful Team HQ Gadgets!
More than 20 additional RESEARCH CARDS
New SUPER VILLAINS - fully-illustrated replacement cards for existing villains and special villain rules
JUSTICE TOKENS that help even out the luck of the dice
A completely rewritten and updated RULE BOOK


The colors of the Hero cards and Research cards are off slightly due to a printing problem, which resulted in very few copies which were printed. The color offset does not affect gameplay in any way.

Expansion for:

Heroes Incorporated
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Variable Player Powers

name: Kaivai Expansion
description:
This expansion to the Polynesian-themed Kaivai includes four new types of huts and one new action:


The Pearl Divers Hut produces shells from fishing.
The Celebration Hut, when built, initiates a celebration on its island.
The Chief Hut gives a counter used to affect bidding costs and which can be used as influence during the end-game.
The Kava-Brewer Hut produces Kava, which can be changed into influence using the new action The Kava Ceremony.
categories: City Building, Civilization, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Gold Dragon Expansion Pack
description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Gold Dragon Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens, and includes Campaign Adventure #6.1: The Pulsating Gate.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: PitchCar: Extra Cars
description: Here come new challengers: 4 Cars in New Colors to expand PitchCar to 12 players.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Racing, Sports
mechanics: Modular Board

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Devoured by Darkness Game Supplement
description:
Description from the publisher:

A deep roar shakes the spongy floor and ribbed walls of the living world, while fleshy bile pumps spurt acidic juices and chitonous Bone Mites scurry across the walls and ceiling. Within the Belly of the Beast, every aspect of the world around is trying to devour you as you pick your way through the pools of muck and fluttering flaps of the impossibly massive creature.

This 15-card OtherWorld Belly of the Beast Encounter Supplement is themed for the corrosive environment, deadly creatures, and terrifying living hazards that fill the pulsating tunnels inside the Belly of the Beast.

CONTENTS

Card #359 Melted Skeleton ×2
Card #360 Beast Quake ×2
Card #361 Deep Roar
Card #362 Necrotic Flesh
Card #363 Bursting Pores
Card #364 Dark Bonding
Card #365 Sunken Bowels
Card #366 Bile Pumps
Card #367 Gonoyoku Clan Survivor
Card #368 Mucus Grubs
Card #369 Bone Mites
Card #370 Fluttering Flaps
Card #371 Stuck in Muck
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Muffin Time: Deluxe Edition
description:
Muffin Time is a chaotic card game with more twists and turns than you can shake a spork at! Battle your friends, family, and hyper-intelligent pets by drawing and playing from a deck of unique cards that'll either help you, thwart others, or mix things up for the sheer hell of it! To win the game, you just need to start your turn with exactly 10 cards in your hand but if you think that'll be easy, you're wrong (wronger than a duck wearing shoes - and that's pretty damn wrong).

This follows the same rules as the regular Muffin Time game. Players draw a card on their turn and can choose to "place" up to three trap cards out of their hand. As a second part of their turn they either pick up one card or play one action card, which are all unique and can have wide-ranging consequences on the other players or game as a whole

The game ends an a player wins when someone starts their turn holding exactly 10 cards.

This deluxe version includes cards from the Pie Flavour and Rainbow booster packs so contains 200 cards (the standard 120 plus 40 from each booster).
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That

name: Firefly: The Game – Loot Crate: Silverhold Promo Card
description:
Silverhold promo card supplied with Lootcrate's March 2016 Firefly Cargo crate. It was also included with Firefly Adventures: Brigands and Browncoats when you preordered the game from Gale Force Nine.

This card is from the Persephone Deck and is played as follows:

Remove from play to use: Draw a card from the Silverhold Supply Deck. If it is a Gear Card, keep it. If not, discard it and draw another card. Repeat until a Gear Card is drawn
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Take That, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Wars: Legion – Jyn Erso Commander Expansion
description:
The shadow of the Death Star looms across the galaxy, threatening any planet that doesn’t fall in line with the Empire. Only those brave—and perhaps foolish—enough to stand against the Empire can hope to save the galaxy from this technological terror. Raised by the extremist Saw Gerrera and on her own from a young age, Jyn Erso embodies both of these qualities.

Reckless and aggressive, Erso is nonetheless a brave leader who can contribute to your battle plan in many ways. Unafraid to wade into battle with her collapsible tonfa drawn, her quick thinking often gets her out of tricky situations. In fact, her Rebellious streak often comes in handy, letting her make a quick strike against an enemy unit or dive for cover before she can be targeted.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Above and Below: Watch It Played Building promo card
description:
A promotional card given out during the 2016 Watch It Played Indiegogo campaign.

This promo introduces a new Building Card that you can use in the game. The building card enables you to receive a cider, once per round, when you do a harvest action. At the end of the game, the card is worth one Victory Point, when the card is added to your village.

Pep McDonald and Rodney Smith are depicted on the card, with the Watch It Played logos on barrels.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Storytelling, Trading

name: 2 de Mayo: Assault on Palace Grimaldi
description:
What if the Spaniards had assaulted Palace Grimaldi and taken Murat prisoner? What if the King's Dragoons had charged? Or what if the French had not used their artillery? Would their principles of Liberty, Equality and Fraternity have been better regarded?

In 2 de Mayo: Assault on Palace Grimaldi, players can explore these and other possibilities, as well as six new game modes (including a double draft and customized modes) of the original game 2 de Mayo.

The expansion consists of a rulebook and 44 cards: 22 new cards and the 22 original cards adapted to play the expansion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic
mechanics: Area Movement, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The 1916 Brusilov Offensive / Gorlice-Tarnow Breakthrough
description:
Part of David Schroeder's "Der Weltkrieg" wargame series.

Gorlice-Tarnow Breakthrough: May 1915

The head of the German armies, von Falkenhayn, wants the focus of the German operations in the war to be on the western front. Yet to make this a reality, he feels that relief must first be provided to the endangered Austro-Hungarians. Recent Russian pressure had almost cracked the final Austro-Hungarian defensive lines in the Carpathians, and new pressure was being brought to bear on Germany's weak ally by the Italians, who had just entered the war.

To help the Austro-Hungarians, a new German army is formed under the capable von Mackensen, and placed in the line east of Crackow. After a furious hurricane barrage, von Mackensen attacks and completely pierces the Russian lines. A Russian retreat ensues that enables the Central Powers' forces to recapture most of Galicia.

Von Falkenhayn wanted to stop operations at this point and shift to the west, but pressure from the Kaiser, at the insistance of Hindenburg and Ludendorff, resulted in a widening of the offensive. Attacks were then launched in the northern sector of the eastern front as well. Enveloped on two sides, the Russians reacted with their classic response, a retreat back into Russia, leaving Russian Poland to the Germans.

The Central Powers offensive wound down as they struggled to supply troops hundreds of miles past the supply heads. The offensive has saved Austria-Hungary from immediate peril, but it does not knock Russia out of the war. And instead of enabling von Falkenhayn to focus on the west, most of the newly created German forces are fed into the increasing vastness of the eastern front.


The Brusilov Offensive: June 1916

In response to French pleas for help to relieve the pressure at Verdun, the Russian STAVKA authorizes a major offensive. General Brusilov plans attacks all along the front of his Southwest Army Group aiming primarily at Austro-Hungarian positions. His belief is that attacks across the width of his front will prevent the enemy from being able to quickly reinforce areas under local attack.

The Austro-Hungarians are caught off-guard as their focus is a new offensive of their own in Italy. The Russian attacks achieves numerous breakthroughs in numerous sectors and many Austro-Hungarian units are completely routed. The Russians take hundreds of thousands of prisoners and advance tens of miles, recapturing significant cities.

German reinforcements are rushed from the north and from Verdun. The Germans also take over command of almost the entire eastern front, and Austria-Hungary is placed in a subserviant position. The Russian offensive peters out as Brusilov's forces start to experience supply shortages, and Central Powers' resistance stiffens.

Brusilov had planned on support from Russian armies to the north to pin down German forces with attacks of their own, but they failed to support him. The losses mount and, after months of fighting, the Russians finally call a halt to further attacks.

The Brusilov Offensive did relieve the pressure on the French and it came very close to knocking Austria-Hungary out of the war. Had Brusilov been supported by his peers to the north, and by the Russian Allies (including the hesitant Romanians) the war might well have been won by the Entente in 1916.


This game contains 2 scenarios covering the 1915 Gorlice-Tarnow offensive and the 1916 Brusilov Offensive.

NOTE: This is not a stand-alone game. It requires the ownership of Tannenberg: Eagles in the East / Galicia: The Forgotten Cauldron and Serbia the Defiant / Romania: Transylvanian Gambit to play.

20km/hex
4 days/turn

560 counters (2 countersheets)
3 small maps (4-5N, 4-5E, 5-5S)

Complexity = medium
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Hanabi: Black Powder Expansion
description:
Hanabi: Black Powder is the 2nd expansion for Hanabi. It adds 10 cards to the game to create a special 6th Fireworks display!

Black Powder card are never part of color clues, they must be played from 5 to 1, and there are three 5s and one 1 instead.

It is compatible with the base R&R version of the game (European versions of the game are not compatible with this expansion, unless all cards are used with opaque sleeves).
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Memory
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Set Collection

name: Arcadia Quest: Poison Dragon
description:
The Poison Dragon is an expansion for both Arcadia Quest, and Arcadia Quest inferno.

It all started with the smell. At first, it just seemed like something had gone off, but it soon grew worse and worse until … Rotwailer the deadly Poison Dragon made her epic entrance at the gates of Arcadia! Unless the Heroes of the city can stop fighting among themselves long enough to focus on this vile monster. Arcadia's future doesn't smell good.

Arcadia Quest: Poison Dragon is an expansion that extends any campaign in the Arcadia Quest line into a truly epic encounter against the sickening Poison Dragon! Divided into two scenarios, Heroes will first need to compete to bring down the dragon, and then cooperate to ultimately defeat it.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Sagrada: Promo 7 – Game Boy Geek Window Pattern Card
description:
Promotional card offered by the "GameBoyGeek Season 6 Kickstarter".

A new double sided player card to build the stained glass window in. Shuffle into the deck with the other player cards during setup and proceed as normal

This card features a level 3 and 6 pattern on opposing sides.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Akaname Tongue Demons Enemy Pack
description:
The Akaname are stealthy creatures that love to Ambush from the shadows. Crawling along the walls and ceiling, they leap over other models and obstacles in their path, scratching at you with their vicious claws and ensnaring you with their long, barbed tongues! When Leaping at a Hero to Attack, an Akaname always moves the shortest distance to reach its target, doing extra Damage on its Combat Hits for every un-spent point of its move remaining! As a ‘Filth-Licker’, the Akaname can also gain bonus Combat for every Corruption Point or Mutation its target Hero has.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Abbott's New Card Games
description:
This book contains nine new card games mostly played with a regular deck. Some of these games were also published separately.


Babel - A real time party game that simulates the stock market. This can play a large number of people as long as you have enough card decks to pull it off (1/3 the number of players)



Leopard - A card game that allows you to sabotage your opponent.



Auction - An auction game where the playing cards are money.



Variety - A game that uses bidding to counteract the possibility of getting a bad hand.



Metamorphosis - A trick taking game where the rules change each hand.



Switch - A partnership game where the partners switch every hand.



Eleusis - An induction game.



Construction - A board game where the board is built with cards.



Ultima - A fast action chess variant.
categories: Book, Card Game
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: dtv (Deutscher Taschenbuch Verlag), Funk & Wagnalls, Jannersten Förlag AB, Langewiesche-Brandt, RBA Libros S.A., Stein and Day

name: Levee en Masse: Expansion Kit
description:
The Revolution Marches On!

STATES OF SEIGE(TM) #5 EXPANSION KIT

The LEVEE EN MASSE EXPANSION KIT broadens the storyboard for the Wars of the French Revolution, starring the man himself: Napoleon Bonaparte! In addition to "the little corporal," who is there to lead the armies of the revolution to victory (and the government to despotism!), there are more Allied armies to face. The forces of Russia, Spain and Britain make their presence felt on the game board, while new Optional Rules allow the player to scrape up the Paris Garrison and fling them into battle, plus play for decisive military victories and defeats.

New scenarios and Designer's Notes round out the package that's sure to put a new "turn" in the revolution!

Note, the LEVEE EN MASSE EXPANSION KIT is not a ‘stand alone’ game. You must own a copy of Levee en Masse to use this expansion kit.

Game Components:

• One instructions sheet with new Optional Rules and Scenarios
• Six additional counters, including Napoleon and the armies for Russia, Britian and Spain
• Twelve new Event cards (2" x 3")

Game Credits

Game Design: John Welch
Docs & Development: Alan Emrich
Playtesting & Proofreading: Ian Wakeham, Bob Flood, and Andy Lewis
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: City of Gears: Juggernaut Mini Expansion
description:
Was available as an add-on during the City of Gears Kickstarter campaign.

Includes its own rules, a unique gear, a special city tile and the juggernaut miniature! When choosing to play with the Juggernaut, you'll always add this tile to the middle of the map. Activating this tile causes the juggernaut to lumber into a neighboring tile, destroying an opponent's worker in the process.
categories: City Building, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Take That, Worker Placement

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – The Raven's Song
description:
A Time of Ravens Expansions

The Raven’s Song is the fourth monthly installment of 40 fixed cards for the A Time of Ravens expansion to the A Game of Thrones card game, based on George R.R. Martin’s bestselling A Song of Ice and Fire saga. It contains 20 different never- before-seen cards designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the A Game of Thrones meta-game.

With the onset of winter, the songs of ravens fill the sky. As the nights grow darker and the winds blow colder, the maesters and stewards of Westeros have taken to their castle rookeries, sending forth a flock of messenger birds with schemes and tidings that will shape the future of the realm.

Expands:
- A Game of Thrones LCG
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Heidelberger Spieleverlag, Smart Ltd

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Outer Space & Reversteam
description:
Two out-of-this-world maps challenge your railroad building and delivering prowess.

Outer Space requires "straight on" deliveries to ensure you don't shoot right by your destination, as well as a handy set of wormholes to get your goods across the galaxy quickly. Things are quite different in Reversteam, where not only has the traditional "great lakes" area been altered, but the cities want every kind of good except for their color.

Available as part of the 2011 Steam/Age of Steam preorder pack from Bézier Games.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Trains
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Cthulhu Wars: Six to Eight Player Dreamlands Map
description: A expansion map for Cthulhu Wars. This is a 6-8 player version of the regular Dreamlands Map, and follows the same special rules of play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Austria, Switzerland & The Netherlands
description:
This Age of Steam Expansion brings the game to Austria, Switzerland & The Netherlands. Each map includes several new rules.


The Austrian map is for 2 players and includes a special 5 spoke Dedicated Town hex tile.
The Swiss map is for 3 or 4 players. Bond buybacks are permitted.
The Dutch map is for 5-7 players and includes a special Goods Demand and Action Display.


This expansion was released in a numbered Essen Set by Winsome Games at Essen 2005. The Netherlands expansion was reprinted in the April 2007 edition of Spielbox magazine. The Switzerland expansion was made free by John Bohrer. The Austrian expansion was reprinted in 2007 by the Steam Brothers in Age of Steam Expansion: Austria & India.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Imperial Settlers: Fette Beute
description:
This "promo expansion" box contains a bunch of promos which had not been published in German language before:

- Expeditionen (Expedition Tokens)
- Die Gilde der Wächter (The Watchers Guild)
- Bernsteinstraße und Flüchtlinge (Storage Tiles)
- Allgemeine Karten der Azteken (Aztecs - Common cards)
- Jagdrevier (Man vs Animals)
- Wirtshaus zum Pegasus (The Dice Tower Inn)
- Ruinen (Ruins)
- Marktplatz (Marketplace)
- Rüstungsschmied & Baracke (Armorer & Barracks)
categories: Ancient, Card Game, City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Lords of Ragnarok: Seas of Aegir
description:
The Aegir monument introduces Snekkar ships. Each player will receive four such boats and will be able to put them on the board in the spot with their Drakkar and then move them on the same rules as their Drakkar (dividing the movement between their Snekkar and/or their Drakkar). The Aegir monument replaces either Thor or Odin from the base game, and Nagflar will replace Loki as an alternate boss.

Contents:
- Aegir monument with associated help and artifact cards
- 20 Snekkar ship models
- Nagflar monster model with monster card

- description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Mythology, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement

name: Magic: The Gathering – Mirage
description:
Welcome to Jamuraa, a land steeped in ancient, magical traditions. Adventure from the religious state of Femeref to the trading province of the Suq'Ata empire to the militaristic kingdom of the Zhalfirins. Strategize with Phasing and Flanking, which make their Magic set debut in this block.

The 350-card, black-bordered set features 110 rares, 110 uncommons, 110 commons, and 20 basic lands. It also introduced two new abilities to Magic: Phasing and Flanking.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Fzzzt! Expansion Pack
description:
The Expansion Pack for Fzzzt adds material for a 5th and a 6th player and 8 cards for the conveyor belt deck.

So the exansions consists of:
4 starting cards for the 5th player
4 starting cards for the 6th player
8 conveyor belt deck cards: 2 production units, 1 Fzzzt, 1 robot upgrade, 4 robot cards

In a 5-6 player game there are only 4 auction rounds instead of 5
(12 cards in the conveyor belt rather than 8 in the standard game)
In a 2-4 player game one can choose a longer game (6 auction rounds instead of 5) by adding the 8 additional cards to the conveyor belt deck.

There are no important changes in the rules.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Pocket Landship
description:
Pocket Landship is based on the print and play Board Game Geek Award nominated (2017) soloplay card wargame. In this version we see a steampunk theme and expanded gameplay with additional enemy and friendly options, as well as multiplayer options.

Command a Landship (the original British term for tanks) to clear a sector of enemy infantry, artillery, and enemy mech and alike.

The player chooses a Landship to control with weapons or support units to create either a single high powered Landship or a more disparate defending force, including a squad of shock troops.

The enemy appears as waves of enemy mech, artillery, infantry, and mine fields arranged in 2 rows of 3 cards.

Each turn, the player will roll 3 6-sided dice and assign each die to each of their cards to attack the enemies. Then, for the enemy turn, roll the 3 dice and assign them low to high left to right across the front enemy line, then take the assigned actions.

Each card has its own damage track. When a card is destroyed, it is removed from the game. Win by destroying all 9 enemy cards. Lose if the enemy destroys your landship.

-description from publisher

The black box version includes the Black Box (a bigger box) which will take sleeved cards. It also includes all the cards, dice and rule booklet from the standard version of Pocket Landship 2nd Edition (including the weather card and die) AND the cards from the 'No Man's Land' expansion.

The box will also have enough room for the sleeved versions of the Kickstarter exclusive cards unlocked during this campaign AND the 2 Driver KS Exclusive cards (which were available separately as an add-on) from the first KS.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Brew: Companion Creature mini-expansion
description:
Companion Creatures provides a powerful new action you can use once per round at any time on your turn. When you use your Companion, turn it sideways to show it is Exhausted. At the end of each round, refresh your Companion to show you can use it again during the next round.

—description from the publisher
categories: Fantasy
mechanics: Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Lotus Frog Games, Pandasaurus Games, Portal Games, Skellig Games

name: Magic: The Gathering – Urza's Saga
description:
From the fires of Shiv to the darkness of Phyrexia, Urza seeks one thing: vengeance. The power of the planes comes to your game with new magic, new powers, and new ways to defeat the Phyrexian forces that stalk you.

This 350-card set marks the beginning of the Urza block, which features new mechanics like Cycling, Echo, Sleeping Enchantments, and Growing Enchantments.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management

name: The Mind: Level 13
description: The Mind: Level 13 is a single card expansion for The Mind, one that allows you to achieve "Transzendentales Über-Ich", that is, transcendental superego, should you be able to complete a round of the game after everyone starts with thirteen cards in hand. Now you can make The Mind last a little bit longer — assuming you even make it to that stage in the first place.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Number
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management

name: Triplock: The Estates Solo Pack
description:
The Forth Solo Episode for Triplock
With the reality of the world beginning to unravel, follow The Stranger through the village that seems to have everything. Everything, that is, but a doorway back to the way things were.

This solo pack comes with a large Location card, 5 Room cards, and a Character: Lottie, which includes 2 Character cards (one large and one small).
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Memory, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Variable Phase Order

name: Rallyman: Sisu cards
description:
4 Sisu cards have been included as goodie in Plato magazine #44 (march 2012).

“Sisu” is a Finnish word to describe the fighting spirit of a Finnish driver.

Each player has a Sisu card he can play once per rally to cancel a loss of control. Discard the Sisu card and make your move without taking into account /!\ symbols.

The Sisu card cannot be used to cancel a loss of control caused by approaching a turn too quickly.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Simulation

name: Hellenica: Story of Greece – Leaders and Legends
description:
An expansion for Hellenica: Story of Greece that adds unique leaders to the game allowing players to modify the characteristics of their city-state.

Each leader confers a special bonus on the city-state that recruits them. For example, Heracles aids in fighting Mythological Creatures while Socrates makes your research more productive.

Each leader is represented by a deck of cards that appear in a market that players review to recruit the leaders that they want. But, watch out, other players may be desiring the same leaders as you and leaders will not serve two city-states!

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Hidden Victory Points, Interrupts, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement
publishers: Active Magic Games, Mr. B Games

name: Zooloretto: Goodie-Box
description:
Zooloretto: Goodie-Box consists of five mini-expansions for Zooloretto or Aquaretto, with four of the expansions appearing previously in Zooloretto/Aquaretto expansion packs published by Rio Grande Games, but not published in Germany. The expansions are:


Zooloretto
The Familiarisation Area – The familiarisation area fits around the zoo board. It has space for 1 animal tile that can be put there for free. This tile doesn't score any points at the end of the game, neither plus nor minus points. During the game this tile can be moved into the zoo for free or you can trade for an animal in another familiarisation area for 1 coin. So basically this is a temporary "storage" for animals.
The Petting Zoo – Each player receives a petting zoo and can place up to two baby animals in this space, receiving one coin for the first animal and two for the second. These animals cannot be moved and generate no points.




Aquaretto
The Trains – Eighteen train tiles, showing trains in one of four colors or a curved track, are mixed with the other tiles. When you take a train tile, you place it in an empty space in your zoo. Each subsequent train tile must connect to existing ones. Each type of train tile is worth two points at game's end.
Three Coworker Tiles – These tiles are placed in the center of the table and can be claimed when a player gets coworkers. Each tile is different and cannot be used by other players once claimed.




Either game
The Savings Book – Each player receives a savings book that depicts the numbers 1-4. Instead of a normal action, the player can place a coin on 1 in his savings book. At the end of a round, a coin in the savings book advances one space, returning to the player – along with an extra coin – when it reaches 4.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Desolate: Insurgence
description:
Desolate: Insurgence is an expansion for Desolate, which adds the ability to play the game with up to four players. In addition to the ability to play with multiple players, Insurgence also adds the Scrap Pile micro expansion. You will need both the core game and both Dark Matters Boosters to use Insurgence.

What Comes in the Box?

1 Stout Box - This extra sturdy box is twice the size of the core game box and will house both the core game and all expansions.

4 Player Cards - These jumbo cards allow each player to track their own character's resources.

1 Position Tracker - This jumbo card keeps track of which tactical position each player is in.

6 16mm Black Dice - Now each player can track their own conflicts.

9 8mm Cubes - These are for each player to track their resources.

4 Jumbo Meeples - These translucent meeples are used to track the player's position.

10 10mm Silver Cubes - Track your scrap with these tokens.

1 Exploration Card - The Workshop allows you to spend scrap to build a power cell.

1 Character Card - Play as a robot with all new mechanics.

6 Items - More items to find, including two all new ones.

10 Tactics Cards - These determine which aliens attack which players during conflicts.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Kaosball: Team – Moonshire Lycanthropes
description:
“Size is nothing. Power and control are everything.”

-Coach Prof

Moonshire is a dangerous place, where any unassuming science major could be moonlighting as a monstrous terror of the night. Enter the Lycanthropes, champion team of this cursed land, who use this newfound control over immense lupine power at will. Bruiser wolf or runner human? Why choose?
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: CDG Solo System Pack #2
description:
The CDG Solo System is a revised GMT Edition of Stuka Joe's CDG solo method, which streamlines two-handed solitaire gameplay by decreasing turn to turn overhead and maintenance. This method of play increases narrative immersion as the great battles of history unfold on your tabletop.

CDG Solo System Pack #2 includes a red and yellow Card Display, a black fate die, the system rules and 6 new playsheets that add solo play to:
- 1960: The Making of The President
- Commands & Colors: Napoleonics
- Commands & Colors: Medieval
- WW2: Barbarossa to Berlin
- Pursuit of Glory
- Wilderness War

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: 7 Wonders Duel: Agora – Tu Quoque Fili promo card
description:
A new Conspiracy card to add to the 16 regular ones in the 7 Wonders Duel: Agora expansion.

Rules: You can copy the effect of another Conspiracy card already triggered by you or your opponent.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Take That

name: Cutthroat Caverns: Hex Room Promo Card
description:
The promo card "Hex Room" was handed out at the Smirk & Dagger booth at GenCon 2009. It is an encounter card for the game Cutthroat Caverns that pays homage to one of Smirk & Dagger's other games, Hex Hex.

Text on the card is as follows:

NON-COMBAT Encounter - No attack cards are 'Set'.
Give Player #1 any token to represent the Hex. The player with the Hex must play an Attack card from his hand. If the first digit of the attack value is Even, pass the Hex to the Right. If Odd, pass to the Left. If 0, pass to any Player. 'Trip' & 'Critical Miss' will cancel any Attack card. 'Not So Tough' can be used to alter an attack value and change the Hex direction. If at any time you cannot play a card with an attack value, you are hexed. The Hexed player must draw an Initiative Card.
1) Lose 20 Life. The Player who sent you the Hex gains 10 Life.
2) Remove all your Items from the game.
3) Get a (-3) Prestige token.
4) Permanently reduce your hand size by one.
5) Get a (-5) Prestige token.
6) Gain 3 Prestige and 20 Life.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Heroes of Normandie: Big Red One Edition – Solo Mode
description:
You left the family farm to go to war, innocent and naive but full of courage and heroic fantasies. Only, the fighting got the better of your youth, of your hopes. Forced marches, skirmishes, ambushes… the last one went wrong, and you found yourself isolated from the rest of your company.

Alone! The countryside around you pulses with danger. Every grove, every ruined house, seems to harbor a threat. You tighten your grip on your rifle, your brother in arms, and advance towards what you think are the positions of your unit…

The single player mode allows you to play solo, and brings with it a lot of exclusive material. It's a whole new way of playing that you are about to discover. With three levels of difficulty to choose from, you are sure to find an opponent of your size.

With two scenarios to introduce you to the principles of the single player mode, the rule book also brings a list of adaptations allowing you to play (or replay) almost all scenarios released so far for Heroes of Normandie and Heroes of Stalingrad. Be careful, though, the enemy is not always the one you think.

You must own a Heroes of Normandie, or Heroes of Stalingrad Core Box to play this Solo Mode.

— description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: RONE (Second Edition)
description:
RONE — Races of New Era — is a strategic post-apocalyptic card game for 2 or 4 players. Players are immersed in a dark world full of destruction and suffering, a world where people are fighting to take back their place after a global nuclear war annihilated all achievements of the human race and all that was left was only a handful of usable resources.

This second edition of RONE includes the core game, plus the New Forces and Awakening expansions in one box. There is new content as well, including features, new art, and add-ons. For back compatibility with the first edition, the cards are populated with an expansion symbol to easily distinguish which card belongs to which expansion.
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Rum & Bones: Skullkickers
description:
Exclusive set of Mercenary heroes for Rum & Bones Kickstarter backers. Contains 5 minatures & hero cards.

Included heroes: Captain Cherry Cutlass, First Mate Drissele (Quartermaster), Kusia the Assassin (Swashbucker), Rex "Baldy" Maraud (Gunner), and Rolf "Shorty" Copperhead (Brute).
categories: Fantasy, Miniatures, Nautical, Pirates
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Gates of the Citadel
description:
Oldtown. It is the oldest city in Westeros, and home to the Citadel, a vast center of learning that is headquarters to the maester organization. Here these educated men forge their chains of mastery and servitude, committing their minds to knowledge, and their service to the realm.

Gates of the Citadel is the first monthly installment of 60 fixed cards--3 copies each of 20 different cards--for the Secrets of Oldtown expansion to A Game of Thrones: The Card Game. The never before-seen cards in this expansion were designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the A Game of Thrones metagame.

The A Game of Thrones LCG core set is required to play. Contains cards 1-20 of the Secrets of Oldtown cycle.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Game Harbor, Giochi Uniti, Heidelberger Spieleverlag, Stratelibri

name: DiceWar: Bond of Demons
description:
Play DiceWar: Bond of Demons to step inside a dark kingdom. Unleash suffering and despair all over the warlands!

DiceWar: Bond of Demons is a expansion for the game DiceWar: Light of Dragons that contains a new tribe to fight against the other two existing tribes from Light of Dragons and Roots of Mali.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Acting, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Grid Movement, Player Elimination

name: King of Tokyo: Zombify promo card
description:
Promo found in the magazine Tabletop Gaming of April 2018. Also came with Game Boy Geek 2018 Kickstarter Family Pack.

If you reach 0 Health for the first time in this game, lose all your VP, leave Tokyo, gain 12 health and continue playing. For the rest of the game, your maximum health is increase to 12 and you can't gain health anymore.

Part of the King of Tokyo series.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Planet Steam: Manipulator
description:
This is the second expansion for Planet Steam.

The Manipulator is given to the player who took his SR card first.

The Manipulator gets access to the computer-controlled price scale. The manipulation have to be done immediately after getting this card.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Trading
publishers: Heidelberger Spieleverlag, LudoArt Verlag, W. Nostheide Verlag GmbH

name: Helvetia: Wanderarbeiter aus Österreich
description:
Migrant worker from Austria

This mini expansion adds a 6th character. This character gives the option to move a not married villager from a building to another free building or the town square at the cost of 1 coin.

This mini expansion was handed out for free by the Österreichisches Spiele Museum at Spiel 2011.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Who Goes There: Blair and Clark Character Expansion Pack
description:
Each character has their own unique abilities and specialty cards ready to help them. With this character pack, Who Goes There can expand to accommodate 5-6 characters. Characters are also interchangeable and can be swapped out to create different teams and add more variety to your game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Fukushima/Chernobyl
description:
The first pair of expansions from AoS Team 2015.

The set contains 2 new maps that takes place in Fukushima and Chernobyl.

The main twist is that hexes are worth money, but they will be destroyed in the mid game.
categories: Economic, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver

name: Epic Card Game: Pantheon – Angeline vs Scara
description:
The Armies of Castillion march under the banner of the Silver Wing, while the Weaver of Sorrow gathers her infernal allies, Angeline's grace will not suffer the corruption of her people as she fights the otherworldly minions of the demonic Scara.

Epic Card Game: Pantheon is an expansion for the Epic Card Game that's packaged in six non-random booster packs (Furios vs Maligus, Helena vs Zaltessa, Angeline vs Scara, Gareth vs Lashnok, Shadya vs Valentia, and Riksis vs Tarken), with each booster pack containing twelve new game cards, 2 deity/token cards, and 1 double sided token card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Run, Fight, or Die!: Jasper City Expansion
description:
This expansion consists of 9 new Follower Cards

They can be identified by the a little "JC" near the red car in the lower right of the card.

The list of cards is:

Bothersome Gas Clerk
the Bowler
HS Physics Teacher
the Gun Nut
Ice Cream Vendor
the Lounge Singer
the Mad Doctor
Nostalgic Punk Rocker
Soldier on Leave

These came with the kickstarter version. Future availability is unknown.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Blue Moon: Earth Spirit
description:
Promo 902 for Blue Moon.

A Leadership card that allows you to draw up to the same number of cards as your opponent if you have fewer in your hand.

It is not affiliated with a people and costs one moon.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Mutants: Next Level
description:
Next Level adds an additional Solo Boss, a new set of Basic Mutants, and two modules that you can incorporate into the game. Heroic Mutants are super powerful mutants that replace some of the Advanced Mutants you would normally have in your Gene Pool. Orbs can be used to give an extra power boost to players that land in the Dread Zone, so they can fight their way back to the top of the Arena. Second Wave Basic Mutants give players the ability to choose their starting deck. Finally, the Zombie Horde is a Solo Boss that's designed to challenge even the most experienced Psy Captains!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – A Song of Silence
description:
Balon Greyjoy, the self-proclaimed King of Salt and Rock, and his Ironborn lords, have seized on the death of King Robert Baratheon as an opportunity to renounce their oaths to the Iron Throne and take the "green lands" by storm. Now, raiders in their deadly longships have set sail to choke Westeros in the arms of the Kraken.

A Song of Silence features the mysterious and power-mad Euron Crow's-Eye, as well as a wealth of synergy for cards with the Raider trait through cards like Longship Silence and Euron's Mongrel.

As with every Chapter Pack in The Brotherhood Without Banners cycle, A Song of Silence includes never-before-seen cards for every faction and also continues the ongoing theme of this cycle by deepening the Brotherhood trait with cards like Hollow Hill and The Mad Huntsman. A Song of Silence will augment existing decks and add variety to the A Game of Thrones metagame.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Iron Gang Hexpuzzles Pack
description:
Neuroshima HEX! 3.0: Iron Gang Hexpuzzles Pack contains clever puzzles to solve on your hex board, making it a perfect way to play some HEX on your own or to challenge your friends!

The Iron Gang Hexpuzzles Pack also includes a bonus army tile for the Iron Gang Army Pack.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Space Cadets: Promo Pack
description:
A small card expansion / promotional give-away for Space Cadets.

It consists of three new Experimental Equipment cards for the Captain, four Special Crystal cards, a cover card with the rules and a grey plastic spaceship miniature.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Fade Promo
description:
This White Box Promotional Expansion for Kingdom Death: Monster expands on the hunt phase. It includes a miniature to represent Fade, a Basic Hunt Event Card and two gear cards which can be gained during this hunt. When this card is encountered, the survivors discover Fade's ultimate fate and can choose to brave the dangerous Harvester in order to gain the Sword of Silence, a Newborn child or possibly both.

This expansion has been said to include some interaction(s) with the upcoming Red Witches expansion.

Gear Cards:

Newborn
Carried Item
No Affinities
Traits: Irreplaceable (If the survivor carrying this item dies, it is archived)
Passive Abilities: while you have this, all of your weapons gain slow. When you return to the settlement, archive this and gain +1 population.

Sword of silence
Weapon, Sword
2 Speed/5+ Accuracy/6 Strength
Affinities: Top; Red Half, Left; Blue Half, Right; Green Half
Traits:
Sentient (You must be insane to wield this weapon)
Irreplaceable (If the survivor carrying this item dies, it is archived)
Unique (There may be only one copy of this item in your settlement at a time)

Passive Abilities: Gains sharp if you have 5+ understanding. While your settlement has this sword, ignore events "White secret" and "White Speaker")
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Florenza: The Card Game –  War and Religion Expansion
description:
Florenza: The Card Game – War and Religion Expansion adds two new kinds of cards to Florenza: The Card Game:


Clergy cards allow you to perform more actions in the game.
Mercenaries give you the possibility of raiding hostile cities — Lucca, Siena and Pisa — to obtain resources or money.


The expansion also allows for games with up to six players.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Renaissance
mechanics: Hand Management, Worker Placement
publishers: Golden Egg Games, Placentia Games, Post Scriptum

name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – The Emperor's Legion
description:
On the blood-stained battle elds of Rokugan, one clan stands head and shoulders above the rest. From the Matsu warriors, to the Akodo tacticians, to the Kitsu who harness the past itself, to face the Lion Clan in combat is an unenviable task for any clan.

The Emperor's Legion, a clan pack for Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game, spotlights the Lion Clan with 78 new cards (three copies of twenty-five different cards and one copy each of three different cards). Here, look for an emphasis on powerful recursion effects, unparalled Bushi, and cards that exact vengeance on your opponent for daring to challenge the might of the Lion.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Horizon Zero Dawn: The Board Game – Thunderjaw
description:
The Thunderjaw expansion allows players to upgrade their quarry to the next level, and test themselves against this terrifying foe. It includes a highly detailed model for this iconic adversary, as well as rules, cards, and special tiles for the encounter.

—description from the publisher
categories: Fighting, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Direchasm – The Starblood Stalkers
description:
The latest addition to the Direchasm repertoire of teams available to conduct tactical combat for game and glory. Compatible for use with all the previous Warhammer Underworlds games.

Contents:
6 Push-fit Starblood Stalkers Miniatures
6 Fighter Cards
12Starblood Stalkers Objective Cards
10 Starblood Stalkers Upgrade Cards
10 Starblood Stalkers Ploy Cards
10 Universal Objective Cards
10 Universal Upgrade Cards
8 Universal Gambit Cards
2 Universal Gambit Spell Cards
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Wargame
mechanics: Command Cards, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Castle Panic: The Dark Titan – Level 6 Agranok Promo
description: A special promotional card that lets you face off against a level 6 version of the Dark Titan Agranok when using The Dark Titan expansion. This version of Agranok has a 50% chance to make you banish a card, and a 50% chance to move two additional spaces.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Mythology
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Trading

name: Core Space: Poseidon Crew
description:
This pack contains a fully playable Trader crew for Core Space, including the skilled Hoskins and the dependable Thoman. Get to know Captain Teelac and his crew in a thrilling new mission, and add a twist to your regular games with the new Assistance Cards and equipment such as the Jump Pack.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Portal of Heroes: Diamonds
description:
Rules:

Setup:
Shuffle the 20 diamond tokens up and place them face-down (i.e.: diamond side up) in easy reach for all players.

Gameplay:
Each time you earn diamonds during the game, take that many diamond tokens from the pile instead of character cards. Turn your diamonds over and put them to the left of your portal face-up.

On your turn you may use diamonds to either:

a) Increase the value of a pearl card, OR
b) Use their special ability


Once used, discard the diamond to a discard pile.

You may use more than one diamond on your turn. If the diamond pile runs out, reshuffle all previously discarded diamonds.

Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2016 for Day 22.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Arena: The Contest – Harun the Shapeshifter
description:
Kickstarter exclusive hero.

Harun's got the only ability you execute before the match even begins: you may choose what Combat Role he is to perform! Your Team could use a Healer? Needing another melee fighter? No problem!


1 miniature
1 character sheet
4 attack cards
Token
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Squatt & Baboo Character Pack
description:
“Squatt! Baboo! Where are you two cretins?! I'm furious! Come here so I can berate you!” ―Rita Repulsa

Rita Repulsa’s most bumbling buddies have joined the fray. But don’t underestimate these two chuckleheads. Though they lack the sheer strength of Goldar or the creative genius of Finster, they make do with moxie and mayhem! It’s time for Squatt and Baboo to shine!

Requires Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid to play.

Features
• Introduce moxie and mayhem to your game with Squatt & Baboo!
• Both miniatures are large scale and highly detailed!
• Expands the award-winning Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid!

Contents Summary:
• 2 Monster Figures
• 16 Monster Enemy Cards
• 3 Monster Deployment Cards
• Rulesheet
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Flagship Cards Resource
description:
The Flagship Cards are a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 4, "The Attack on Earth," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, The Dominion War. It is considered a Resource.

Resource:
Beginning with Month 4 of the Dominion War Organized Play Event, "The Attack on Earth," each player may equip their fleet with this Resource. The Squadron Point Costs for Resources are located on the Resource Reference Cards. Players may choose from among any available Resources for the Dominion War Storyline OP, but cannot change Resources between Battle Rounds.

The Flagship cards allow players to choose a maximum of one ship in their fleet to gain extra abilities. There are 8 different flagships on double sided cards. Four of them are faction specific, and the other 4 are Independent faction and can be equipped to any one ship (the ship becomes dual faction). The Flagship card may be added to a squadron for 10 Squadron Points.

Romulan Flagship

+ 1 attack, +1 agility, +1 shields

Ability: When attacking, all other friendly Romulan ships within Range 1-2 of your Flagship may choose any number of their attack dice and re-roll them once.
Additional Action: Sensor Echo
Additional Upgrade Slots: Talent, Weapon

Klingon Flagship

+ 1 attack, +1 agility, +1 hull

Ability: When attacking, all other friendly Klingon ships within Range 1-2 of your Flagship may convert 1 blank result into 1 HIT result.
Additional Action: Cloak
Additional Upgrade Slots: Crew, Tech

Dominion Flagship

+ 1 agility, +1 hull, +1 shields

Ability: When defending, all other friendly Dominion ships within Range 1-2 of your Flagship may convert 1 blank result into an EVADE result.
Additional Action: Scan
Additional Upgrade Slots: Tech, Weapon

Federation Flagship

+ 1 attack, +1 hull, +1 shields

Ability: When defending, all other friendly Federation ships within Range 1-2 of your Flagship may choose any number of their defense dice and re-roll them once.
Additional Action: Battlestations
Additional Upgrade Slots: Talent, Crew

Independent Flagship (Back of Federation card)

+ 1 attack, +1 hull, +1 shields

Ability: After your Flagship moves, you may target 1 other friendly ship within Range 1 of your Flagship. Target ship immediately performs a 2nd Action listed on its Action Bar as a free Action this round.
Additional Action: Evade
Additional Upgrade Slots: Crew, Tech

Independent Flagship (Back of Dominion card)

+ 1 agility, +1 hull, +1 shields

Ability: After your Flagship moves, you may target 1 other friendly ship within Range 1 of your Flagship. Target ship immediately performs an extra white or green Maneuver.
Additional Action: Target Lock
Additional Upgrade Slots: Talent, Weapon

Independent Flagship (Back of Klingon card)

+ 1 attack, +1 agility, +1 hull

Ability: All other friendly ships withing Range 1 of your Flagship gain +1 attack die when attacking at Range 2-3.
Additional Action: Scan
Additional Upgrade Slots: Talent, Tech

Independent Flagship (Back of Romulan card)

+ 1 attack, +1 agility, +1 shields

Ability: When defending, all other friendly ships within Range 1 of your Flagship gain +1 defense die.
Additional Action: Battlestations
Additional Upgrade Slots: Weapon, Crew

Rulings and Errata
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Vision & Winter Soldier
description:
Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Vision and Winter Soldier allows you to add two new characters to the Marvel: Crisis Protocol miniatures game.

Originally created by Ultron to destroy the Avengers, the android known as Vision turned against his creator and joined Earth's Mightiest Heroes. Vision is able to alter his density, allowing him to phase through solid objects, and to augment his strength and durability to incredible levels. Using the solar gem in his forehead, Vision can synthesize energy from his surroundings and focus it into highly destructive energy blasts.

James Buchanan "Bucky" Barnes fought alongside Captain America during World War II, before seemingly meeting his demise while on a mission. Years later, Barnes re-emerged as the brainwashed Russian agent known as the Winter Soldier. Eventually, after crossing paths with his old friend and partner Captain America, Bucky was able to shake off his Russian programming and reclaim his freedom.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Tesla vs. Edison: Powering Up! – Bonus AI Pack
description:
The bonus AI pack offers two new AI personalities for each of the six playable inventors: Nikola Tesla, Thomas Edison, Madam CJ Walker, Elihu Thomson, Charles Brush, and Sir Hiram Maxim. This double the two AI personalities from the Tesla vs. Edison: Powering Up main expansion.

The AIs in this Bonus Pack represent computer science pioneers Alan Turing and Grace Hopper.

Note: This pack was included with the Powering Up! Kickstarter edition.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Stock Holding, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: The Sherlock Files: Vol IV – Fatal Frontiers
description:
Are you a modern mastermind detective?

The Sherlock Files: Final Frontiers includes three new confounding cases for you to solve - all taking place in Tornado Town, a place full of quarrels, cowboys, and cahoots.

First, you will delve into the sordid history of a mine rumored to be cursed. Next, you will unearth the truth of who has been desecrating graves in the Tornado Town cemetery. Finally, you will investigate a fatal duel that killed both participants at sunrise.

Decipher clues to determine which are relevant to the case and which are not. Share what you deem relevant with your detective partners. Which theories will you chase?

How will you fare compared to the world’s greatest detective? Work together to solve each case and find out!
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory

name: Alien vs Predator: Hot Landing Zone
description:
Alien vs Predator: Hot Landing Zone (AvP:HLZ) is an expansion to Alien vs Predator: The Hunt Begins (AvP:THB) tactical board game. In this expansion, rules for new Models are being introduced for each Faction! The AvP:HLZ expansion allows for the different Forces to do battle on limited visibility on the planet’s dense surface Jungles.

Each Model presents new tactical opportunities or a more advanced foe your Force needs to overcome, and they can be added to your existing AvP:THB Force or your used according to the Advanced Rules’ Custom Forces.

The Transport and Harass mechanic is introduced, in the form of a Dropship’s pilots taking part in the struggle for survival. The Human faction uses the Dropship to rapidly relocate their forces, while the Alien and Predator Factions try to make it too Hot a Landing Zone and cancel the Airlift operations.

AvP:HLZ presents additional rules, where you get to play a Free for All scenario of up to six players. Additional gaming boxes will be needed for this purpose, and use of add-on packs and Advanced Game Rules is highly recommended.

Whether you play using the Basic Rules or the Advanced Rules of the AvP:THB rulebook, this expansion allows you to expand your board game with the inclusion of Jungle Tile rules and other components, allowing for new and exciting Squads to join the fray. The use of Advanced Rules is enhanced as well, through additions to all Strategy and Event Cards, to either be added into the respective Decks, or replace cards from the basic set.

Core Set of Alien Versus Predator: The Hunt Begins in required to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Montana: Longhorns
description:
Longhorns graze on the meadows, but if a settlement is built, they must move to somewhere else. Sometimes that goes without any problems, but if you push too hard it can cause problems for everyone.

Fortunately caravans visits the settlements with new supplies. Trade with them, so you can easily get other goods. Finally ranches are built in the settlements. To build a ranch is a great investment, but it unlocks a permanent special ability. Ranches also provide considerable prestige and that is needed to win the game.

The expansion consists of three module which can be combined with the base game and any other expansion.
Module 1: Ranches
Players need to build 3 ranches and 12 settlement to win the game.
Rances cost a lot of resources but give player special abilities during the game.

Module 2: New supplies
During the build action players can trade resources for other resources.

Module 3: Longhorn
Longhorn meeples are placed on the board during the setup.
When building a settlement on a longhorn space, the longhorn needs to move.
Each turn a longhorn is move a rule is changed in the game (sometimes good, sometimes bad)
categories: American West, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Set Collection, Worker Placement
publishers: Big Kid Games, White Goblin Games

name: Super Dungeon Arena
description:
Originally released as a downloadable ruleset, Super Dungeon: Arena is an alternative game mode for players to use with their existing collection of Super Dungeon models. In Arena, two players each take control of a mighty warband consisting of one Hero, one mini-boss, two spawning points, and the spawning points’ associated monsters. These warbands then do battle against one another in a challenge known as a scenario. Each scenario has its own unique rules and victory conditions, which require a warband to use its abilities and strengths in new and clever ways.

Super Dungeon: Arena includes a beautifully illustrated rulebook, an intricately detailed double-sided game board, an Arena Champion model, and numerous cards, tokens and dice for players to battle it out head-to-head. As players construct their own warbands from any combination of Super Dungeon models or from a single warband box, Arena promises to be an exciting experience each time.

Super Dungeon introduced the world to the whimsy and charm of chibi-miniature board games inspired by classic video games, and it continues to be the leader in providing a fun and lighthearted family board game experience. Strongly supported with dozens of expansions which provide new Heroes, monsters, dungeon tiles, and gameplay options, Super Dungeon: Arena is sure to be fun, new edition for longtime fans and new fans of Super Dungeon!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Unfair:  Kickstarter Exclusive Sneak-Peek Promo Cards
description:
12 playable sneak-peek cards from future expansions for Unfair. These are Kickstarter temporary exclusives marked with an asterisk symbol in the bottom right hand corner. They came in a pack including a thank you card for Kickstarter backers.

Also on this card were instructions for use:

Cards with an asterisk symbol for their theme packs are promotional cards. You can add up to 1 copy of any promo cards you wish to use in your game, unless that card is already in chosen packs.

The 12 included cards were:


Alien Ambassador (Alien Theme)
Crop Circles (Alien Theme)
Triceratops (Dinosaur Theme)
Electrified Fence (Dinosaur Theme)
Database Hacker (Hacker Theme)
VR Pod (Hacker Theme)
Street Performer (Medieval Theme)
_____ Kingdom (Medieval Theme)
Gunslinger (Western Theme)
Vacant Lot (Western Theme)
Zombie Horde (Zombie Theme)
Z-Day (Zombie Theme)



With the release of the Unfair ABDW expansion, 6 of these cards have now officially expired:

description:
Imperial Lords is one of the 2 official expansions released by Milton Bradley and Games Workshop for Battle Masters. This one adds about 25 new miniatures for the 'good' side, including new powerful warriors and some additional rules. These expansions were released in Europe only.

Battle Masters

name: Dungeon Degenerates: Guide To The Würstreich – Tomb Lake & The Wetlands
description:
Tomb Lake & the Wetlands is a shambling chaperone into this soggy sector of stale swamp. Take a closer look at the stagnant stench surrounding the Black Tree, ponder the eldritch origins of the stone circle & gaze into the ghastly gulf of Tomb Lake! Tomb Lake & the Wetlands is full color, lavishly illustrated with lurid descriptions of the Würstreich, its history, culture & denizens - with 4 NEW MISSIONS INSIDE! Really adds another dimension to your game play. 32 pages, pamphlet style.

—description from the publisher

description:

After the Brothers' War, Dominaria goes cold and dark, dominated by an overzealous church determined to ban magic. Two magic schools persevere in whispered fables and deep secrecy.

This 119-card set, the fourth Magic expansion, features many cards that pair tempting Magic abilities with damaging penalties.

name: Deutscher Spielepreis 2018 Goodie Box
description: The Deutscher Spielepreis 2018 Goodie Box is a product to support the Deutscher Spielepreis, the second biggest German board game prize, for which thousands of players vote each year between May and July for their favorite game. This box contains small expansions for some of the top ten games of the Deutscher Spielepreis 2018: Azul, Rajas of the Ganges, Altiplano and The Quacks of Quedlinburg.

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – A Change of Seasons
description:
A Time of Ravens Expansion

A Change of Seasons is the third monthly installment of 40 fixed cards for the A Time of Ravens expansion to the A Game of Thrones card game, based on George R.R. Martin’s bestselling A Song of Ice and Fire saga. It contains 20 different never-before-seen cards designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the A Game of Thrones meta-game.

As the warm embrace of summer releases its grip to the harsh winds of winter, the continent of Westeros is in turmoil. The change of seasons will send the timid and the weak into hiding, longing for better times. But for the cunning, the opportunistic, and the bold, the chaos surrounding the onset of winter will be seen as the means to power!

Expands:
- A Game of Thrones LCG

description: Well - it's been a long time! This Kneipenquiz-expansion tests the knowledge from school days and puts general knowledge to the test even more. 250 brand-new questions can be combined with Kneipenquiz - Das Original and Fußball-Spezial.

name: Dungeon Drop: Mysterious Shiny Purple Cubes Mini-Expansion
description:
This Dungeon Drop mini-expansion incorporates six of the best ideas collected from the community. Roll at the start of each new game to see exactly what strange effects these cubes will have for that dungeon!

—description from the publisher

Originally included as part of the Kickstarter Deluxe version of Dungeon Drop.

name: Chachapoya: Yayaucha Promo
description:
The base Chachapoya game is expanded by a new obtainable but dangerous God of Sand cards. We should shuffle the YAYAUCHA promo cards into the treasure deck, after it prepare the other card as it's written in the game rules.
In case of 2 players playing discard 20 randomly choosen cards. If 3 are playing discard 15 cards and if 4 players, discard 10 cards and put them back into the box without looking at them.
These cards are not used in this game.
Follow the original game rules.
Enjoy playing the game and have fun with treasure hunting!

—description from the designer

name: Rotterdam: Masters of Trade
description:
Masters of Trade is an economical boardgame. It is the expansion to the harbour game Rotterdam which increases control over the game for the players. Therefore the game is suitable for fans of the Rotterdam game and game lovers.

The players need to choose out of 8 different roles and they may decide when to use these roles. They distinctive roles in Masters of Trade are: ship owner, captain, deck hand, discharger, trader, shipping agent, cashier and manufacturer.

Added to the Rotterdam game are the product market and the commodities market, the harbour planning, factories and money pieces.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Transportation
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Trading

name: St. Nazaire: Operation Chariot
description:
St. Nazaire: Operation Chariot

An ASL historical Module published by le Franc Tireur.

St. Nazaire contains everything you need to play, except the half-ton of ASL material that you always need: one counter sheet, one historical map, a rules booklet and 15 scenarios. Through 8 scenarios, this pack depicts on a historical map of the St. Nazaire harbor the Commando Raid of 1942. Rules cover searchlights, extra powerful DC charges as well as complete rules for Motor Gun Boats (MGB). Also included are 7 scenarios that allow you to use these MGB rules on various theatres of operations (including the shores of Finland, Yugoslavia and the Pacific Ocean), opening a whole world of new ASL gaming opportunities.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Cranium Booster Box 2
description:
This is a 2nd expansion set for the Cranium base game. It adds 800 new cards and 4 sets of clay. The cards and the clay are also part of the Cranium Primo Edition.

Expands:

Cranium
