name: Skytear: Ashen Pass
description:
Ashen Pass is a new battlefield for Skytear featuring just a single lane but two domes.

It is ideal for quick and tight matches lasting 20 to 40 minutes.

It’s best played with two different outsiders and requires 4 heroes per side.

The box contains a neoprene playmat measuring 350x400x2mm with stitched edges.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: The Blood of Gondor
description:
When your heroes chase after a band of Orcs fleeing into the woods of Ithilien, their hunt leads them perilously close to the hidden enemies from The Blood of Gondor Nightmare Deck. In The Blood of Gondor, your heroes are ambushed on all sides by "hidden cards," which enter your play area facedown until different effects force them to flip over. The Blood of Gondor Nightmare Deck amplifies the tension and excitement this mechanic creates, adding more effects that cause you to take hidden cards, more effects that flip them over, and a number of nasty surprises that trigger when they're flipped faceup.

Nightmare Decks for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game allow you to revisit your favorite scenarios cast in the shadows of the game's challenging Nightmare Mode. Featuring deadlier enemies, darker locations, and more terrifying surprises, each Nightmare Deck introduces new, alternate encounter cards and instructions for using them to reshape a scenario's encounter deck. The result? A nightmarish journey through territory you thought you knew, but with twists and turns that will have you on the edge of your seat!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: The Pursuit of Happiness: Community – Found Animal Promo Card
description: The "Found Animal" card was a promo that was given out for free at Artipia's booth at Essen Spiel 2017. It is a Community card (so you need the expansion to use it) and it also interacts with Pets, so it works best if you have either of the Kickstarter Promos (both the main game's and the expansion's stretch rewards contain pets).
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Simulation, Worker Placement

name: Reinforcements: New U.S. and Soviet Units for Assault
description:
Reinforcements - New U.S. and Soviet Units for Assault, is the first Assault Series module, and it required Assault or Boots & Saddles to play.

From the back cover, "Now you can have a complete set: with this module, plus Assault and Boots & Saddles, you will have counters for every type of U.S. and Soviet maneuver unit likely to be in central Europe..."

The Assault game system uses 250 meter hexes, 5 minute turns, and platoon/section sized units.

Game Content:
Two countersheets (360 5/8" counters)
One 4 page additional rules booklet
One 4 page Briefing Folder
Three player aid charts
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Dungeons & Dragons: The Legend of Drizzt Board Game – Vierna Do'Urden Promo
description:
Vierna Do'Urden is a promo card (#3) that was being given out at Comic Con, GenCon, and PAX for participating in the Legend of Drizzt Demo.


Vierna Do'Urden
Drow
AC - 14
HP - 4

Tactics

If Vierna is within 1 tile of a Hero, she attacks the closest Hero with a poisonous curse. After the attack, pass this card to the player on your right.
Otherwise, Vierna curses the active Hero. That Hero's player draws the top Encounter card. After the draw, pass this card to the player on your right.


Attack - +6
Damage - 1 and poisoned

4 Experience
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Arctic Scavengers: Tribal Leaders Promo Pack
description:
Increase your pool of Tribal Leaders with this promo pack for Arctic Scavengers. Included in this pack are the Chemist, Gambler, Merchant, and Poacher, as well 5 "Crate of Pears" cards.

Chemist --> Equipped medicine works like tools (i.e. one per tribe member card, modifiers cannot add a new skill, can be disarmed, etc.). The Pharmers gang is offended by your abuse of medicine. You cannot win them.

Gambler --> When activated, first discard one of your cards which is in play, Then draw the top card from your deck to replace it. You may then rearrange cards to make optimal use of tools and other modifiers which are in play.

Merchant --> Exchange can be performed multiple times per round. The dig penalty is permanent and applies to every round.

Poacher --> Additional food requirements applies even on rounds in which your Refugees don't hunt. Merchants hired without food (such as Hunter) do not add food to the cost if it wasn't there to begin with.

Crate of Pears (x5) --> This is a timer based tool which starts at zero. Once drawn from your deck, play it from your hand and deployed in your base much as you would a building. At the start of each turn, rotate the card clockwise to represent food thawing (it starts frozen). At any time, trash the card to trade the crate of partially thawed food [0-3] during a hire action.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting
publishers: ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, Rio Grande Games

name: Dust Tactics: Schwer Sturmgrenadiere Ausf. A – "Heavy Recon Grenadiers"
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Allied forces sought shelter in an abandoned warehouse. The communications officer's voice was drowned out by the sounds of wood shattering and the rapport of heavy machine guns. Three Axis soldiers marched heavily into the warehouse. Because of the darkness and obstructing rows of crates, it was hard to tell, but they appeared to be wearing battle suits of heavy armor.

Engage and destroy Allied squads with the Axis Heavy Recon Grenadiers, an armored squad expansion for Dust Tactics. Marching onto battlefields in combat armor, these soldiers can shrug off enemy gunfire and are practically invulnerable to infantry small arms fire. Their enemies are much less fortunate. Each member of the Heavy Recon Grenadiers wields two powerful MG 44 rifles designed to mow down Allied infantry in a lead rain. Take command of these elite soldiers,
shrug off enemy fire, and turn the tide of the war!

Three unpainted miniatures are exquisitely sculpted in dynamic battle-ready poses. The Heavy Recon Grenadiers make deadly squad killers, and their resilient body armor lets them join with some armored heroes.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dreamscape: On Purpose Mini-Expansion
description:
Once you meet the requirements of your Purpose card (see overleaf), reveal it, score its Slumber points, and put it on top of your completed card stack.

Using a Purpose card
As long as it is on top of your complete card stack, you can put a shard (except red) from your Hands onto your Purpose card to use any Dreamworld Power
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Movement Points, Pattern Building

name: Off the Dead: Chapitre 2 – Venice Beach brûle-t-il?
description:
New expansion under development for Off the Dead

From the publisher website:

Less than a week after the onset of a virus that has transformed a large part of the California population in tanned and rabid cannibals, Venice Beach is the site of another disaster. Vicious creatures, evil and mentally undeveloped, land on the beaches: the military.

With this first expansion of Off the Dead, play a new survivor, go in search of new equipment and slaughtered new nasty zombies.

This new chapter also introduces another way to win: scenarios. Flee on a desert island, find an antidote against the virus or eradicate all stiffs with a nuclear bomb, it is you who decide!

Included in the box: The rocket launchers, flamethrowers, smoke grenades, shovels, a soldier severely burne, a mad scientist, a general freak, zombie dogs, a bunker, a hypermarket ... Off The Dead? What else!
categories: Card Game, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Deadball: Year II
description:
Deadball: Year II is an expansion to the bestselling Deadball: Baseball With Dice, a tabletop game for 1-2 players that uses real stats to bring the ballpark to your tabletop. It requires the original game to play.

Designed to make an elegant game even simpler,

Deadball: Year II contains:

New rules for devastating injuries, lightsout relievers, vicious beanballs and benches-clearing brawls
Nine Game Pennant: A new game mode that launches players into the climax of a classic pennant race
A ballclub generator that can create a legendary franchise in minutes
16 fully-fleshed out fictional teams, featuring over 300 players and more than 75 detailed write-ups
Essays by esteemed national baseball writers Will Leitch, Britni de la Cretaz and John Thorn, official historian of


Major League Baseball

Baseball is hard. Deadball is now easier than ever.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Modern Battles II: Four Contemporary Conflicts
description:
The "Modern Battles II" Quadrigame consists of four contemporary games. These games are completely new and individual and are sold separately and as a complete set.

The games included in this Quadrigame are:


Bundeswehr - Northern Germany, late 1970's (Hypothetical)



Yugoslavia - The battles for Zagreb, 1979 (Hypothetical, but eerily prescient of a civil war between the Serbs and the Croats.)



Battle for Jerusalem - a fierce and bloody battle fought between Israeli and Jordanian forces during the Six Day war of 1967.



DMZ - The Battle for South Korea, late 1970s (Hypothetical)


The game mechanics used in this series are similar to those found in other Quadrigames. The Standard Rules are identical to those used in the first Modern Battles (Quad). In this new series the same scale is used (one mile per hex and 12 hours a turn). Units range in size from companies to brigades. Artillery units have the ability to add to the defensive strength of friendly units being attacked. Artillery has various ranges, some in excess of ten hexes.

Also included (in various games) are rules for Untried units, special river conditions, other special terrain, airpower, ammuniton depletion, B-52 and B-1 bomber attacks, commandos, paratroopers, stacking, garrison units, bridge destruction, militia, artillery suppression, command control, helicopters, replacements and international cooperation.

Movement is sequential and single-phased. Zones of Control are rigid, and combat is mandatory between adjacent units. The Combat Results Tables (there are two, representing different doctrines) use a differential system. The "Active Combat Results Table" is very bloody, with a large possibility of exchange and elimination, even at low odds. The other table, the "Mobile Combat Results Table" is a bloodless CRT, offering mostly retreat results.

Terrain varies from flat, open plains to some of the most rugged in the world. The terrain effects on combat are taken into account by a system whereby the combat differential is actually altered (column sifts) by the terrain the defending unit occupies.
categories: Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: The Silver River: Deluxe Edition
description:
The Silver River is a 4X game that takes place in our own galaxy, the Milky Way, known in some Eastern cultures as The Silver River. The game includes Humans and different alien races, all of which some believe really exist in our galaxy. Races include:

Greys
Arcturians
Reptilians
Yahyel
Nordics
Insectoids
Martians

The deluxe edition and contains all upgrades from Kickstarter
Expansion and Upgrade Kit:

Two additional playable alien races: The White Lions & The Cyborg!

20 plastic spaceship minis to upgrade ship tokens from the base game: 4 each of 5 different ships

Upgraded Trade Stations: 20 Plastic trade station minis
Cubes, ships, tokens, map layout, additional player mats and screen to add a 5th player!
categories: Civilization, Industry / Manufacturing, Political, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Trek: Away Missions – Chancellor Gowron: Klingon Expansion
description:
Klingons are warriors trained from birth to fight. They are deadly and tough, and their weapons are brutal. Few others can stand up to a Klingon in a one-on-one fight.

As a Klingon player, you can’t go wrong by simply getting up close and personal with the enemy. Seek out honor and the death of your foes!
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Forging the Chain
description:
Fantasy Flight Games is pleased to announce the next exciting Chapter Pack for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game, Forging the Chain! The second pack in the Secrets of Oldtown cycle continues to expand the reach and influence of the Maesters, adding more links to their chains of knowledge.

For an overview of the Secrets of Oldtown cycle of expansions, be sure to check out this article, "Chained and Sworn", featuring insight from the set's designer, Nate French.

Forging the Chain features 60 never-before-seen cards cards (3 copies each of 20 unique cards) that are designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the A Game of Thrones metagame. Featuring Pale Steel Link, Bronze Link, and Oldtown Scholar, as well as more in-House Maesters, Forging the Chain will add new dimensions to your A Game of Thrones experience. This Chapter Pack also expands each House's specialties with more Clansmen for House Lannister, search abilities for House Stark, and much more! Forging the Chain also includes a new shadowy version of the mysterious and deadly Jaqen H'ghar.

This winter, serve your House with wisdom and forge your chain...
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Game Harbor, Giochi Uniti, Heidelberger Spieleverlag, Stratelibri

name: Catan Geographies: North Rhine – Westphalia
description:
Die Siedler von Catan - Nordrhein-Westfalen edition is part of a series of historical regional map expansions for the venerable Settlers of Catan line. The new line profiles famous regions of Germany during the Middle Ages, when Celts, Romans, and Germans intermingled.

This fixed map covers the Nordrhein-Westfalen area of Germany, which includes the modern-day industrial area around the river Rhein (Rurh). Many BGG-ers will recognize the city of Essen. The geographic features (resource hexes) and cities mirror the approximate location of their real-world counterparts. "Harbors" ring the playing field.

The rules follow closely to standard Catan, with a few notable exceptions:
Players may only build cities in the round intersections denoting actual cities. Because some of the cities are only one hexside apart, the spacing rule requiring two roads between settlements is not in effect. Having built a road to a hex with a settlement, one cannot build a road leaving it until one has build a settlement on the hex. Finally, to obtain the benefit of a harbor, it is only necessary to lay a road on the hexside shaded in red.
Furthermore, victory points can be obtained by building the first road onto a "victory point crossing." These points are indicated by tokens (e.g. from the Seafarer's expansion) placed there.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Waste Knights: Second Edition – Call of the Waste
description:
The Call of the Waste mini-expansion comes with:


10 unique Landmark cards
10 cardboard Landmark tokens.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Napoleon's Battles Module 1
description:
This is the 2nd installment for the Avalon Hill miniatures based game of Napoleon's Battles. It is a 54-pages Booklet with 'Errata' & clarifications for the 1st game, additional Terrain features, with 9 more Scenarios, the Divisional Armies Structured Army Charts, Additional Optional Rules, even MORE labels for these Scenarios, a set of BLANK 'generic' Officers labels and a BLANK information chart for further uses.

The Scenarios covered in this are:
S-9.The Battle of Valmy, Sept.20,1792;
S-10.The Battle of Friedland, June 14,1807;
S-11.The Battle of Corunna, Jan.16,1809;
S-12.The Battle of Aspern-Essling, May 21~22,1809;
S-13.The Battle of Ocano, Sept.19,1809;
S-14.The Battle of Salamanca, July 22,1812;
S-15.The Battle of Leipzig, Oct.16~19,1813;
S-16.The Battle of Craonne, Mar.7,1814;
S-17.-A 400 Point Demonstration Game-1814.

Most of the 'Battles' covered here involve a single gaming table while the S-12.Aspern-Essling battle uses 2 tables and the S-15.Leipzig battle has 4-(!) tables being used for it's playing.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Shadow Kingdoms of Valeria: Kickstarter Edition
description:
Every Kickstarter copy of Shadow Kingdoms of Valeria will include Rise of Titans - 4 Advanced Expansion Modules packaged inside the base game's box. They publisher will sell these modules on their website but these modules will not be available in the retail edition.

Module #1: Shrine of the Titans
This is a 6th Shrine that occupies the cavern at the center of the game board. After each battle, you will place your highest value Troop die into the Shrine of the Titans.
The Shrine can hold a number of Troop dice equal to the number of players. On your turn, you can move your Warden token to the Shrine of the Titans and buy up to 3 dice...if you have enough Gold. This module also includes 5 additional Troop dice.

Module #2: Great Battles
This is a set of 10 oversized Battle Plan cards in which all the players can participate. 2 Great Battle cards are always available throughout the game and each time you complete a regular Battle Plan, you check your dice to see if any of them match the Troop Types noted on the Great Battle cards. If there's a match, you add the lowest strength matching die to one of the Great Battle cards along with one of your Participation Markers. You immediately gain the reward on the Troop Position chosen.
When all 5 Troop positions are filled on a Great Battle, the card is resolved and each Participation marker on that card earns you a share of the Victory Points for that Great Battle. This module also includes 20 Participation Markers and 5 additional Troop dice.

Module #3: Ancient Spells

This is a set of 28 cards (44x68mm) with 2 of 6 unique and powerful actions spread throughout the cards in every possible combination. During setup, shuffle the cards and give 3 to each player.
At any time during your turn, you may play an Ancient Spell card from your hand to perform one of the two available powers. It's important to note that playing an Ancient Spell card is a free action along with your regular action. These spells are meant to augment and boost specific actions, dice, etc.

Module #4: Wraith Dice

This is a set of 5 purple custom dice (16mm - same size as the other dice in the game). During setup, just toss the 5 Wraith Dice into the bag along with the usual dice needed for your number of players. Each die has Strength of 1, 1, 2, 2, 3, and 3, (opposite sides always add up to 4) so they are weaker than the regular Troop dice, but this also means that they're more likely to give you better Discounts if you draft them at the Tactics and Champions Shines, and more likely to pay out more gold if you draft them from Gold Shrine.
Wraith dice are considered WILD when completing any Battle Plan. So, even though they're weak, they can be any Troop Type you need. Wraith dice are also wild if you put them on a Great Battle card (Module #2). When you draft a Wraith die, it DOES NOT take up a Troop slot on your Player Board! You just set it somewhere on your Camp and use it when you need it most. The flexibility of these new dice will add lots of new play options to your game of Shadow Kingdoms of Valeria.

About the base game:
For years the humans, elves, and dwarves have been slowly encroaching on your territories and slaying your kind in the name of progress. They've built their citadels, keeps, and villages as they push you further into the darkness. Now is the time to rally your troops and lay waste to their kind and bring forth the reign of the Shadow Kingdoms!

You are a Warden hungry for the destruction of Valeria. You must outwit the other Wardens to earn the right to command an army for the Shadow Kingdoms. Visit dark Shrines to gain minions, magic, gems, and gold to fuel your war machine. Command monsters into battle to conquer the lands and earn Victory Points. The player with the most Victory Points at the end of the game will be declared the winner.

On your turn, you must move your Warden from its current location to a new location. When your Warden enters one of the 5 Shrines, you first take any available die from the Shrine and place it on your player board, then perform the Shrine action associated with the Shrine.

There are 5 troop types (die colors) in the game: Goblin (green), Orc (red), Skeleton (white), Gargoyle (purple), and Gnoll (brown). Send your Warden to the Camp on your player board to use your minion dice to resolve battle plans and place Victory tokens on your Campaign board.
categories: Dice, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Worker Placement

name: Four Against the Netherworld: A Supplement for Four Against Darkness
description:
Abandon all hope!

Four Against The Netherworld is a supplement for Four Against the Darkness, for character levels 6-9.

In its pages you will find:

New classes: Demonologist, Cambion, Cleric of Zur, Cleric of Foryos, and a reworked Paladin;

A complete economic system for the Netherworld;

Rules for hex-based exploration, with plenty of terrain types, and a downloadable color map of the known regions of the Netherworld;

Six new spells for wizards and cambions;

New Reactions: Burn Souls, Capture, Conversion, Demonic Pact, Mercenaries, Demand Obeisance, and more;

Tables to generate encounters and events; Plenty of new, deadly monsters, including randomly generated Lovecraftian aberrations.

This is not a stand alone game. To use it, you need a copy of Four Against Darkness and Four Against the Abyss.
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Allies of Necessity
description:
Description from the publisher:

“Do you want to know the odds of her using that blaster on you? It’s high. It’s very high.”
–K-2SO, Rogue One

If anything defines the Star Wars saga more than the lightsaber duels, blaster firefights, and epic space battles, it’s the friendships that emerge out of hardship and necessity. Whether it’s Luke Skywalker and Obi-Wan Kenobi looking for a smuggler to take them offworld or ex-convict Jyn Erso forced to work with a ragtag group of Rebels, outcasts, and Imperial defectors, these alliances can determine the fate of the entire galaxy.

Within Allies of Necessity and the new Alliances cycle for Star Wars: The Card Game, you gain plenty of incentives to bring multiple affiliations together. While multi-affiliation decks have always been a possibility, Allies of Necessity offers more tools to help you than ever before—starting with new affiliation cards, which offer new deckbuilding requirements and special abilities. What’s more, you’ll find iconic characters from Rogue One, Star Wars Rebels, and the Darth Vader comics throughout the cycle: in fact, this first Force Pack includes Doctor Aphra, Director Krennic, Captain Cassian Andor, and Jyn Erso.

With eight new objective sets (two copies each of four distinct sets), and twelve brand-new affiliation cards (two for each affiliation), Allies of Necessity promises to change your games like never before!

Contains objective sets 261-1264.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

II and Sea Gladiator variants) and the Fiat Cr.42 Falco. From Belgium to Finland, from Hungary to Norway, many nations started the war with these beautiful and agile machines. Even Chinese Gladiators are included in the set, to reenact air duels over Asia even before WW2 started.

It contains 28 airplane cards and 2 'L' Maneuver Decks.

Part of the Wings of War series.

Solo players can choose 4 levels of difficulty: Easy, Normal, Hard and Extreme (for the masochists among you).

description:
A new army deck to include in the main game.
Details will be envailed soon but it will also include new stories.

In this game, each player has two decks of cards that represent his army and his strategic plans. They deploy their starting troops on the board and alternate turns to defeat their opponent in one of two ways:

Disbanding the opposing army by emptying their ranks.
Reaching at least ten Victory points by defeating enemy units and completing secret objectives.

You can recreate famous historical battles such as Quatre-Bras, Ligny, Waterloo or Wavre with the scenarios included in the game, or you can change history by building your own armies with the deck-building aspect of the game.

description:
Game description from the publisher:

"All she wanted was to go home, but leaving King's Landing was not so easy as she had hoped. She had been sleeping in Flea Bottom, on rooftops, and in stables, wherever she could find a place to lie down, and it hadn't taken her long to learn that the district was well named..."

A Time of Trials is the second monthly installment of sixty fixed cards for the "King's Landing" expansion to A Game of Thrones: The Card Game, based on George R.R. Martin's best-selling A Song of Ice and Fire saga. It contains three copies each of twenty different never-before-seen cards designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the A Games of Thrones metagame.

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: The Steward's Fear
description:
The Dark Lord's spies have infiltrated the White City, and their nefarious Plot threatens to plunge all of Gondor into darkness. It's up to your heroes to cleanse Minas Tirith of this evil, but The Steward's Fear Nightmare Deck ensures that the conspiracies run deeper than ever, your foes are more cunning and deadly, and the fate of Gondor rests upon a razor's edge!

Nightmare Decks for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game allow you to revisit your favorite scenarios cast in the shadows of the game's challenging Nightmare Mode. Featuring deadlier enemies, darker locations, and more terrifying surprises, each Nightmare Deck introduces new, alternate encounter cards and instructions for using them to reshape a scenario's encounter deck. The result? A nightmarish journey through territory you thought you knew, but with twists and turns that will have you on the edge of your seat!

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Argon Gass Exclusive Figure
description:
Argon Gass is an promotional figure for the game Krosmaster: Arena.

Foggernauts were originally humans, ones who could wield technomagic. They lived underwater for many centuries in their sunken homelands. Over time, the technomagic they used slowly started to convert them into living machines. The only human thing about them now is their spirit. And after many centuries, the Foggernaunts have risen from their watery prisons to claim the stasis crystals on the land, the source of their power and craving. And Argon Gass is one of them.

Argon Gass plays as a close range fighter, where his short range Sonartillery makes short work of his foe's armor. To assist him with his close range style, he has heavy armor and self repairing capabilities to shrug off attacks, letting him keep going where flesh and bones can't.

description:

The heat shimmer that ripples above the parched earth does little to mask the horrors that lie assembled before you. You must focus on the task ahead. No plan survives contact with the enemy and the army you face is a howling, ravening horde of death that will test you to the limit. Today will be recorded in history but only one side will write it. Do you have the skill and courage to ensure it is you? Go. The time for war is now!

Welcome to Uncharted Empires, an Army Supplement book for Kings of War, the massed combat tabletop fantasy game set in the magical realm of Mantica. In this book, you are going to find:


Nine brand new Kings of War armies giving budding generals a whole host of new options and dastardly tricks to outfox and out-fight their opponents, including The Brotherhood, Salamander Armies, The Herd, The League of Rhordia, The Trident Realms of Neritica, The Empire of Dust, Night-Stalker Armies, Ratkin Armies and the Varangur

name: Carcassonne Müller Exklusiv-Edition
description:
Carcassonne is a tile-placement game in which the players draw and place a tile with a piece of southern French landscape on it. The tile might feature a city, a road, a cloister, grassland or some combination thereof, and it must be placed adjacent to tiles that have already been played, in such a way that cities are connected to cities, roads to roads, etcetera. Having placed a tile, the player can then decide to place one of his meeples on one of the areas on it: on the city as a knight, on the road as a robber, on a cloister as a monk, or on the grass as a farmer. When that area is complete, that meeple scores points for its owner.

During a game of Carcassonne, players are faced with decisions like: "Is it really worth putting my last meeple there?" or "Should I use this tile to expand my city, or should I place it near my opponent instead, giving him a hard time to complete his project and score points?" Since players place only one tile and have the option to place one meeple on it, turns proceed quickly even if it is a game full of options and possibilities.

This special edition is sold exclusively by the German trade company Müller. It comes in a similar metal box as previous special editions and contains the Carcassonne base game along with the expansion set Carcassonne: Expansion 6 – Count, King & Robber and Die Belagerer which is a new six-tile version of Carcassonne: Die Katharer (with new graphics but similar to the Rio Grande Games (2008) release).
categories: City Building, Medieval
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement

name: Cthulhu Wars: Dire Azathoth
description:
Dire Azathoth is a new Independent Great Old One expansion.

Control a Gate on an enemy Faction's Start Area.
Pay 10 Power, and place Dire Azathoth into the Area.

Combat: Roll a die. Dire Azathoth's Combat rating is equal to the result of the roll.

Mindless Destruction (Post-Battle): Any Faction Battling in Dire Azathoth's Area gains his choice of either 1 Doom or 1 Power for every Unit that Faction Kills or Eliminates in that Battle. (Dire Azathoth need not be involved in the Battle).

Spellbook - Dire Azathoth.pngSpellbook - Dire Azathoth (The Blind Idiot God).png Spellbook Requirement: As an Action, pay 20 Power.
The Blind Idiot God (Game Over!): Immediately win the game, even if you do not have all 6 Faction Spellbooks or the most Doom.

name: Ice Duo
description:
Ice Duo is a collection of two "pyramid" games: IceDice and Twin Win.

• Twin Win is played on a 3x3 grid, with players trying to match stacks of pyramids to one of two hidden goal cards dealt to each player at the start of play. Players have two ways to win, ergo Twin Win.

• IceDice is a press-your-luck game in which you want to complete three matching sets of pyramids by rolling dice; if you can't get the pyramids you want from the bank, you can possibly steal them from your opponent.

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Nightvault – Garrek’s Reavers
description:
The Bloodbound warband led by Garrek Gorebeard are frenzied killers whose excesses have drawn them irretrievably into the thrall of the Blood God. Should they fall upon their quarry they will tear them apart, and with the blood of the fallen, they will defile the Mirrored City so utterly that Khorne’s eye will be drawn to this damned place – and the gory tributes of his loyal servants...

Introduce Garrek’s Reavers, a Khorne Bloodbound warband previously available in the Warhammer Underworlds: Shadespire boxed game, to your games of Warhammer Underworlds: Nightvault and take advantage of new and different ways to play – whatever warband you use – with this set of miniatures and cards. It includes 5 Khorne Bloodbound miniatures and a deck of 60 cards, 31 of which are universal to be used by any and every warband – add these cards to your arsenal and build your perfect deck.

Included:


5 push fit, red-coloured plastic Khorne Bloodbound miniatures: Garrek Gorebeard, Arnulf, Karsus the Chained, Blooded Saek, Targor

name: Steampunk Rally: Lizzie Magie
description:
Activation: Place any two dice with matching pip values to gain 3 movement.

Bonus: You have 3 "Hotel" tokens (borrowed from another game on your shelf).

At the end of each Race Phase, each opponent must pay you 2 cogs per Hotel on their current Track Tile. If they cannot pay, they must discard machine parts with cogs showing in the corner (if they have any), gaining those cogs from the supply, until they have enough to pay.

Then, you may place a die showing pips equal to or greater than the number of opponents in the game (max. 6) from your Pool onto the Hotel Dice Slot to place a Hotel token in the corner of any Track Tile. If you place a Hotel on a tile with no other Hotels, you must reclaim any previously placed Hotels. The die used can be vented later as normal.


Lizzie Magie was a writer, comedian, actress, engineer, feminist, and political activist best known for creating The Landlord's Game, intended to illustrated the ills of land grabbing and the unfair advantages of property ownership and exploitative rent practices. The game developed a cult following with many fans of creating their own game boards, including a group of Quakers in Atlantic City. Three decades after it's creation, Parker Brothers published this version with the title "monopoly" (with the political message sanitized), and the rest is board game history!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Railroad Dice: Germany
description:
RailRoad Dice - Germany, is an expansion of Wassertal Spieleverlag's first game: RailRoad Dice - The First Rails. It is not your typical game expansion, but is a completely new game, with several new rules, and potentially new strategies. It is built on the firm foundation of the original game and should be a quick learn for experienced players.

There are two main changes to the game: The map is now a 4 by 6 grid tiles representing Germany, and the Directorship, that is, who owns the track is determined by who transported the most players for a company, not who bought the most shares. Additionally, being Director means that you get 5 dice in income during your turn, and not 4 dice.

These two changes alone should make for a very interesting game.

It must be said that the game does not include any new dice. The standard set of dice in the original game has not been expanded. Some of the same rules apply: You only build or lay track on one or two tiles, as soon as you leave a tile, the track dice are removed and the station dice are left behind.

New terrain features are rivers with special crossing rules for them, and that you can only build stations in specific locations indicated on the map. When you build a station at that location, you get the number of passengers for that station, 3,000 or 5,000, plus an additional 1,000 for every "share" symbol or question mark die you spend. This makes it easier for a player to get back into the game if they have fallen behind.
categories: Dice, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Hold the Line: French and Indian War Expansion Set
description: Include 75+ plastic miniatures with French, American Ranger, and Indians joining the fighting associated with the Hold the Line, The American Revolution game. This expansion comes with 12 new scenarios and new tiles specifically designed for the game.
categories: Age of Reason, American Indian Wars, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Flesh Mites Enemy Pack
description:
Crawling and burrowing through the fleshy tunnels in the Belly of the Beast, these oversized, armored parasites feed on the remains of undigested intruders. They have evolved thick, interlocking, chitinous shells which make them immune to most acids and explosives, allowing them to burrow deep into the intestinal track of the beast in search of food to scavenge. Though not particularly intelligent, the hungrier a Flesh Mite gets, the more vicious it becomes, sniffing the air with its face tentacles until it finds the scent of its next meal!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Epic Card Game: Pantheon – Riksis vs Tarken
description:
Riksis sees beauty in chaos and destruction. He seeks the music of ruination everywhere he goes. Tarken's steady hand arrives to prevent everything Riksis holds sacred. Can the Dancer of Destruction break the resolve of the wisest of the gods?

Epic Card Game: Pantheon is an expansion for the Epic Card Game that's packaged in six non-random booster packs (Furios vs Maligus, Helena vs Zaltessa, Angeline vs Scara, Gareth vs Lashnok, Shadya vs Valentia, and Riksis vs Tarken), with each booster pack containing twelve new game cards, 2 deity/token cards, and 1 double sided token card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Chachapoya: A Yapalocté Expedíció
description:
The base Chachapoya game is expanded by new dangerous cards, modules and a board. The adventurous archeologists have returned to South America in order to search for the treasures of Yapalocté.
In the game you can switch the cards to more dangerous ones and you can put the new unique cards into the base Chachapoya game.
Be careful you can get eliminated easily if you are too brave in this adventure.
Enjoy playing with the game and have fun taking part in this expedition!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Fantastiqa: Fantastic Events Expansion
description:
The Fantastic Events Expansion contains 24 extra cards -- all EVENTS -- to make your adventures in FANTASTIQA that much more fantastical. These cards are combined with the Creature Card deck at the beginning of the game.

This expansion will become available at retailers around 12/1/2012.


FAIRY RING (Event--6 cards total): Place 3 gems from the supply in your current Region. A player who ends her turn in this Region may claim ONE of these Gems.



UNRULY ARTIFACT (Event--3 cards total): Draw two Artifact cards and tuck one part-way under each Region holding an Artifact Tower. A player who ends his turn in a Region with an Unruly Artifact immediately adds this card to his Discard Pile.



WAYWARD BEAST (Event--3 cards total): Draw two Beast cards and tuck one part-way under each Region holding a Beast Bazaar. A player who ends his turn in a Region with a Wayward Beast immediately adds this card to his Discard Pile.



MISPLACED QUEST (Event--3 cards total): Draw two Quest cards and tuck one part-way under each Region holding a Quest Chest. A player who ends his turn in a Region with a Misplaced Quest immediately claims this card and places it face-up in front of him like any other Quest.



MAGIC CARPET RIDE (Event--3 cards total): Each player may immediately fly to the Region of her choice at the cost of 1 Gem per Region traveled.



TRICKSTER RAVEN (Event--3 cards total): Each player must pass one card from her hand to the player on her right.



MARKET DAY (Event--3 cards total): All players may freely buy, sell, or trade with one another this turn.


See FILES for a detailed-filled PDF summary of all FANTASTIQA expansions.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Ultimate Werewolf: Wolfpack
description:
Who are the most famous werewolves in the world? Better yet, how about the most famous *wolves* in the world? Ultimate Werewolf: Wolfpack has them all and in ways you'd never expect.

This expansion for Ultimate Werewolf has six new roles for your werewolfing fun. Think werewolves are too meek? That's because your villages have never had The Big Bad Wolf, who leads the werewolves to eliminate villagers twice as fast while he's in the game. On the opposite end of the spectrum is the terrifyingly-confused Fruit Brute, who is, of all things, a vegetarian. Elizabeth Taylor was pretty scary as Martha the crazy socialite, but every game you'll want to know who in your group is actually afraid of Virginia Woolf. And there's three more famous wolves, including one that totally coincidentally shares a name with one of the X-Men.

Ultimate Werewolf: Wolfpack is compatible with Ultimate Werewolf and Ultimate Werewolf Deluxe Edition
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.R.W. Praetus Expansion Pack
description:
The I.R.W. Praetus is a 22nd century Romulan Bird of Prey that utilizes an early version of Romulan cloaking technology. The vessel has no shields, and its ability to use its cloaking device involves several risks to the ship’s main systems.

Unlike other ships in Attack Wing, the Praetus can use a Cloak Action even though it has no Active Shields. However, this is risky and involves rolling a die to see if the ship is damaged. The Praetus is known to patrol cloaked minefields which present considerable danger to enemy ships flying through them, although this danger can be partially mitigated through an intensive scan of the area.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Third Reich Deluxe Map
description:
The map to John Prados' Third Reich, printed on nice, thick paper at double the normal size. On this one, there's plenty of room to move your pieces around. Sea area BRP values have been added, and the handful of minor errors in the hard-mounted map corrected. This is a must for hard-core players of John Prados' Third Reich.

Expands:

John Prados' Third Reich
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Munchkin Duck of Gloom
description:
Munchkin Duck of Gloom is a plush duck in the style of the "Duck of Doom" card from Munchkin, but colored black instead of yellow. The duck has a zippered pouch so that you can store stuff inside it – but to do that, first you'll need to remove the two game cards that come with it: the new Munchkin card "Curse! Duck of Gloom", as well as a new card for Atlas Games' Gloom.

Part of the Munchkin series.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles – Nemeses
description:
An expansion set which will challenge Heroes to face an extraordinary opponent: their own dark side. Heroes’ Nemeses are the “evil twins” of the Heroes, embodying their darkest thoughts and fears, the evil recesses of their souls. A Hero's Nemesis is a being of pure evil, with the destruction of the Hero as its only purpose, and skills and powers to match him.
—description from publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Orient Express: 5 Nieuwe Mysteries
description:
This expansion to the Jumbo edition of the "Orient Express" base game offers 5 new atmospheric cases to solve, all written by Ben Leijten, who was also the man behind the cases for the Jumbo base set:

JUMBO 11) "De Tiende Penning" (der zehnte/the tenth penny)
JUMBO 12) "Lov'lier Olliver" (anagramme waren seine leidenschaft)
JUMBO 13) "De Wasbeurt" (katzenwaesche/the washing schedule)
JUMBO 14) "Dressed to Kill" (der tod kam beim mummenschanz)
JUMBO 15) "Een Aasgier Geveld" (der tod des geiers/a vulture is slain)

Publishing History: "Orient Express" first appeared in the USA in 1985, published by Just Games and was quickly picked up by Jumbo NL which released a reworked version for the European market one year later. The main difference between the two editions is that the European interpretation is much more co-operative as a lot of the information is shared by all, making it a more open, but somehow also a faster and more atmospheric experience for all involved.

Since there were only 10 solvable cases that came with the base game, it was inevitable that additional cases had to be published to keep its players' base entertained. Both publishers happily obliged, each releasing their own additional sets. Jumbo only released 5 extra cases that appeared in Dutch, French, Italian and German, meaning that not all of their European language editions saw additional cases beyond the initial 10. And like before, the murders are pretty tough cases to crack, as even with all the available information revealed, some educated guesses willstill have to be made by the competing sleuths.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Trains
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Superfight: The Red Deck
description: Superfight: The Red Deck — an expansion for the Superfight party game in which players pit unusual characters with superpowers and superweaknesses against one another — adds "one hundred really terrible and likely offensive cards" to the base game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Storytelling

name: Aqua Garden: New Facility Expansion
description:
Additional variations to the game with a new aquarium module and 3 types of advanced fish tokens requested by the backers from the base game.

-description from the kickstarter campaign
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Rondel, Set Collection, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Set-up

name: Ascension Year Six Collector's Edition
description:
Celebrate the 6th Year of Ascension with the latest Collector's Edition! Gift of the Elements and Valley of the Ancients are re-released with their promotional cards and original cards finished in premium foil.

Enjoy the fan-favorite sets released in Ascension's sixth year with the Year Six Collector's Edition! Battle in style - all cards feature a premium foil finish! Beautiful cards and premium components make this the perfect centerpiece for you Ascension collection.

Includes Ascension: Gift of the Elements , Ascension: Valley of the Ancients.

Premium components including 100% foil cards, foil game board, portable storage box, dividers and an Honor token bag!

Playable as a stand-alone 1-4 player game and completely compatible with other Ascension expansions!
categories: Card Game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Catan: Seefahrer – 20 Jahre Jubiläums-Edition
description:
Catan: Seefahrer is an expansion for Catan that includes many water hexes — as well as many different water-hex-heavy variant set-ups — in which players can build shipping lanes, which function similar to roads.

Catan: Seefahrer – 20 Jahre Jubiläums-Edition includes four new scenarios packaged under the title "Die Legende der Seeräuber".

From the publishers site (unofficially translated from German), announced January, 30th 2017:
For 20 years the most popular Catan expansion "Seafarers" adds with a few additional rules endless new possibilities and permutations to play. For the anniversary this May this fascinating expansion will now be released with additional bonus material.

The Anniversery edition includes additionally four new scenarieos: „Legend of the Sea Robbers“. The intense narrative tells, how the sea robbers came to Catan and is connected by an ongoing plot. Therefore, a new way to play is introduced to the CATAN universe.

The scenario expansion „Legend of the Sea Robbers“ will be available as well as a separate box without the content of the Seafarers expansion in selected stores as well as the Catan Shop.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Nautical, Negotiation
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Apocrypha Adventure Card Game: Box Three – The Devil
description:
GIVE THE DEVIL ITS DUE.

Angels and demons colluding in the bright casino lights. Animals and plants coiling around us in the night. Strange outsiders entering the world through your dreams. Snake cultists seeking to raise a dragon from an Aztec pyramid. All these and more come together for a highly unsettling apocalypse.

The Devil is an expansion for the Apocrypha Adventure Card Game that can be played as a co-op card game for 1-6 players or a full roleplaying game with one player acting as a guide.

The Devil contains four chapters, each containing cards that detail memories written by a legendary author. This box contains:

The Book of the Animus, in which the New Orleans bayou is threatened by the great spirit of nature, with memories by Kij Johnson.
The Book of the Damned, in which Las Vegas is overrun with demons and angels preying on the weak-willed tourists, with memories by Erin M. Evans.
The Book of the Dreamers, in which the cities of New England are invaded by twisted nightmares, with memories by Keith Baker.
The Book of the Serpents, in which the ancient ruins of Mexico are unearthed by snake worshippers searching for the last dragon, with memories by Wolfgang Baur.


—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Resident Evil: The Board Game – Into the Darkness Expansion
description:
Tiptoe through the Third Floor and the underground cave system in tense new scenarios where you’ll face rotating tiles, boulder traps, and poison. Watch out for the enormous Yawn’s gaping maw, and the ensnaring webs of Black Tiger and her spiders...

Dare you step into the darkness and take on these two huge new bosses, so big they engulf multiple squares?

Including six gripping new scenarios, this expansion adds 8 hours of extra gameplay to your Resident Evil: The Board Game campaigns. Or, play each scenario as a terrifying standalone experience.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Miniatures, Video Game Theme, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Darkest Night: Enchanter Promo
description: The Enchanter is a special, promotional package that is being offered exclusively to BoardGameGeek. This package includes the Enchanter along with 10 power cards, plus a new event and an artifact. A must-have for all Darkest Night fans!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Sherlock Files: Vol III – Puzzling Plots
description:
Are you a modern mastermind detective?

The Sherlock Files: Puzzling Plots includes three new confounding cases for you to solve. First, you will track down a man who vanished during his shift at the cemetery. Next, you will pursue the truth of what happened to a fabulously rich butler. Finally, you will hunt down the man behind the wheel of a suspicious hit-and-run.

Decipher clues to determine which are relevant to the case and which are not. Share what you deem relevant with your detective partners. Which theories will you chase?

How will you fare compared to the world’s greatest detective? Work together to solve each case and find out!
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory
publishers: Indie Boards & Cards, Indie Game Studios

name: Tiny Epic Kingdoms: 2nd Edition – Deluxe Edition
description:
Tiny Epic Kingdoms 2nd edition deluxe includes the base game and Tiny Epic Kingdoms: 2nd Edition – Deluxe Promo Pack.

Tiny Epic Kingdoms 2nd Edition features these refinements taken from community feedback:

Rulebook clarifications.
Faction card clarifications.
Game component improvements.
Players may now retreat from war.
Improved 2 player variant (The Lost Kingdom)
TEK Exploration tiles now included in every copy (previously they were included in the deluxe content for 1st edition.

The first deluxe edition may be found here Tiny Epic Kingdoms: Deluxe Edition

About the game:
You are a tiny kingdom with big ambition. You want to expand your population throughout the realms, learn powerful magic, build grand towers, and have your neighbors quiver at the mention of your name. The conflict? All of the other kingdoms want the same thing and there's not enough room for everyone to succeed...

In Tiny Epic Kingdoms, a 4x fantasy game in a pocket-size package, each player starts with a unique faction (which has a unique technology tree) and a small territory. Throughout the game, players collect resources, explore other territories, battle each other, research magic, and work to build a great tower to protect their realm.
categories: Bluffing, Civilization, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Follow, Take That, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game – Assault on Castle Grayskull
description:
Assault on Castle Grayskull’s new game mode puts players into one of two teams: the aggressors, who are attempting to take down the castle walls to gain control of Castle Grayskull, and the defenders, who must attempt to withstand the siege and protect its magical secrets.

This expansion brings powerful tools for both defenders and aggressors alike. As the game progresses, you will choose powerful Upgrades that aid you in your attack or defense of Grayskull: Should you play as the defender, you will have the castle’s full array of tools at your disposal. Build a mighty Laser Turret to rain down firepower on your foes! Raise your Banners high to grant boosts to your troops! As the aggressor, cunning strategies and tools are available to you as you plan your assault: Force Shields, Battle Ladders, and more are at your disposal.

—description from the publisher

Expansion comes with 2d castle overlay. Plastic Castle Greyskull must be purchased separately.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – Fokker D.VII
description:
From the publisher:

The Fokker D.VII was a German World War I fighter that quickly proved itself to be a formidable aircraft. The D.VII was noted for its high maneuverability and ability to climb at high angles of attack, its remarkably docile stall, and its reluctance to spin. It was flown by a number of famous German aces such as Hermann Göring, Gotthard Sachsenberg and Rudolf Stark.

Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW1 Wings of Glory Airplane Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards.

This is not a complete game.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: AT-43: Operation Frostbite
description: AT-43: Operation Frostbite includes new figures, scenery, a rulebook with new weather effects and scenario book. Included scenarios use both the Frostbite tile set and the Damocles tile set. The expansion includes comprehensive campaign rules for battles on the ice planet of Elysee.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Dreadball: Season 3
description:
Adds a further 4 teams to Dreadball

Teratons - Lizardlike Aliens with the ability to teleport.
Asterians - Who use fouls and dirty tricks to win the game.
Zees - Clones who use thier similarities to get more than the allowed number of players on the pitch.
and a nameless team - Squid tentacled aliens.

Plus more MVP's and large multihex players.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Heroes of Normandie: Extra Terrain Set #2
description:
Publisher Blurb:

With these adjustable terrains piece, modify your battlefields to renew your gaming experience. There is nothing more boring than being hacked to pieces by machine guns always at the same spot.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Magic Maze: Roundabout Tile
description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for day 1.

Any Hero pawn on the external spaces of this tile can only move clockwise, in the direction of the arrows. They can leave this tile as usual, through any open pathway or by exploring a new tile.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Real-time

name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Starter Team 20 Pan Asia
description: 15 new cards for Baseball Highlights: 2045: Starter Team 20 Pan Asia (V12) - Veteran Mix 12.
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Take That

name: Skull Tales: Tortuga Expansion
description:
Splice the mainbrace, seadogs and landlubbers, and welcome to Tortuga! A new expansion for Skull Tales: Full Sail! with many challenges for your heroes. Roam the streets of Tortuga in search of rumors, meet bizarre and mysterious new characters, like the dark Papa Ghede and his black magic, or Stan the charlatan merchant... Tackle the Brotherhood’s challenges and their new assignments for their captains, and sail through Caribbean waters to discover new keywords in the Voyage Cards.

So get your crew ready and weigh anchor to discover these 110 new cards for Skull Tales: Full Sail! (core game required to play this expansion).

This expansion includes (You can shuffle these new cards with the decks of the game):


40 Voyage Event cards.
8 Rumor cards.
7 Assignment cards.
55 Port cards (11 per Location).


—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fan Expansion, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph

name: Arctic Front: Finland's War, 1939-1944 – A Panzer Grenadier Scenario Book
description:
Adds Finnish troops to Panzer Grenadier. 20 scenarios and 88 mounted and die-cut counters with Sissi ski commandos, Finnish-made BT-42 assault guns, Soviet SMK heavy tanks and Aerosans (An aerosan is a type of propeller-powered snowmobile, running on skis, used for communications, mail deliveries, medical aid, emergency recovery and border patrolling in northern Russia, as well as for recreation.) Aerosans were used by the Soviet Red Army during the Winter War and the Second World War.

Not playable by itself, but an expansion for Panzer Grenadier: The Eastern Front and Heroes of the Soviet Union.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: SiegeStorm: Frost Giants
description:
Additional PvP faction. This expansion contains 56 new cards.

Mysterious folk and creatures of North - they are the reason why northpole is stil undiscover (besides low temperature of course). Frost Gigants often use their weather - controlling abilities to create Blizzard over battlefiled which brings doom to their foes. At first they may seem weak but when they reach certain point they become unstoppable. If you prefer setting up the late game and dominate in the later stages of the game Frost Giants would be perfect deck for you.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Piwate Island
description: Come sail away to the magical island offered in Krosmaster: Arena – Piwate Island, an expansion for Krosmaster: Arena that includes a new double-sided board, a single figure, and punch board. Rules for the new island are also included.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Fairy Tale (fan expansion for Dominion)
description:
This is an unofficial fan-made expansion, and is not affiliated with nor endorsed by Donald X. Vaccarino or Rio Grande Games.

Magic has come to your domain. You knew you were taking a risk when you opened the borders to those magic bean salesmen, but surely hiring the troll to collect tolls on your new bridge was the right move? The old fortune teller who came to your castle that fateful night said that your wishes would come true, and now everything you touch is turning to gold, and your servants seem to have been replaced by walking brooms with arms!

You scoffed when your advisers told you those old wizards were dangerous, but now, with strange lights flashing over the nearby mountains at night, you can't help but wonder if they were right. Will you hire a sorceress to cast spells at your behest, or a huntsman to deal with those mysterious wolves that are plaguing the countryside? Only by wit, courage, and a little hard-earned wisdom will you be able to protect and expand your dominion.

Fairy Tale is a free, unofficial, print-and-play expansion for the game Dominion.
Details and a download can be found below in the files section of this page.

It adds 21 new Kingdom cards to Dominion, including 10 Actions, 2 Treasures, 3 Victory cards, 5 Durations and 1 Reaction. The central theme is cards that do multiple things.

Background
Dominion is designed by Donald X. Vaccarino, and is published in the USA by Rio Grande Games. Fairy Tale is an unofficial fan-made expansion is not affiliated with nor endorsed by Donald X. Vaccarino or Rio Grande Games. Fairy Tale was originally designed by D. Brad Talton, Jr. and after William Stewart offered to help, he passed the project on to him and the BGG community.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Patchwork Doodle: Plus
description:
Mini expansion from Lookout Magazine "Ausguck"
Cards with new shapes and an additional special ability.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: The Drúadan Forest
description:
As your heroes pursue the Dark Lord's servants into the Drúadan Forest, a surprising revelation and new mechanics thrust you into a desperate battle for your lives! The Drúadan Forest Nightmare Deck ensures that the forest's Wose enemies and their Prowl mechanics make powerful impacts from the game's outset, all the way through its dramatic conclusion.

Nightmare Decks for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game allow you to revisit your favorite scenarios cast in the shadows of the game's challenging Nightmare Mode. Featuring deadlier enemies, darker locations, and more terrifying surprises, each Nightmare Deck introduces new, alternate encounter cards and instructions for using them to reshape a scenario's encounter deck. The result? A nightmarish journey through territory you thought you knew, but with twists and turns that will have you on the edge of your seat!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Poetry for Neanderthals: More Cards Box 1
description:
More Cards Box 1 is the first expansion to Poetry for Neanderthals.

Poetry for Neanderthals is a competitive word-guessing game where you can only give clues by speaking in single syllables. So, instead of saying "broccoli," you'd say something like "green thing you eat for live long and have good health." If you mess up and use a big word, such as "vegetable," you get bopped on the head with a NO !Stick and you lose points.

The goal of the game is to score the most points by correctly interpreting words and phrases. The chosen Poet starts off the game with a Poetry Card and tries to get their teammates to say the listed word, using only words with one syllable within a 90-second time limit.

The box contains 500 new double sided cards. That’s 2000 new words and phrases to use with Poetry for Neanderthals.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Team-Based Game

name: Thunderstone Advance: Towers of Ruin – Modules
description:
This 16 page booklet was given out by Pegasus Spiele at the 2012 Essen SPIEL fair.

It contains several variants and scenarios for Thunderstone Advance.
categories: Card Game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Sun Elf Wizard Expansion Pack
description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Sun Elf Wizard Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens, and includes Campaign Adventure #3.3: The Toll of the Dread Alarum.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Beyond The Wall Promo
description:
This White Box Expansion includes a small vignette depicting Aya the Survivor in dangerous times. This expansion also includes the remaining two gear cards that complete the Vagabond Armor set from 'Before the Wall'.

The gear cards are crafted via recipes printed on the back of them.

These gear cards are:

Hard Breastplate
Leather/Vagabond Set Torso Heavy Armor (3 Armor points)
Affinities: Top; Red Half, Bottom; Blue Half
Automatically Activated ability: Green + Blue Affinity required: Ignore the first severe injury you suffer each showdown

Cloth Leggings:
Vagabond Set Leg Accessory (Legs, 1 Armor)
Affinities: Bottom, Green Half
Passive Ability: When you suffer the Bleeding or Bloody Thighs severe injury, only gain 1 bleeding token)

Note: Cloth Leggings use the starting item 'Cloth' gear card to craft them.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Scrap Metal
description:
Description from the publisher:

Throughout the saga, Star Wars has been defined by rivalries and conflict. Luke Skywalker, hero of the Rebellion, is opposed by Darth Vader, one of the Dark Lords of the Sith. Han Solo, a smuggler from the Outer Rim, is tracked by Jabba the Hutt and his teams of bounty hunters. Princess Leia Organa is taunted and questioned by Grand Moff Tarkin. These enmities and threats bring the characters to life, and now, you can bring some of these rivalries into your games of Star Wars: The Card Game with Scrap Metal, the next Force Pack in the Opposition cycle.

Like the other Force Packs of the cycle, Scrap Metal comes with ten new objective sets (two copies each of five distinct sets), each challenging the way you view the battles between the factions of Star Wars: The Card Game. Here, you’ll find a host of new versions of iconic characters, including Jabba the Hutt, C-3PO, R2-D2, and Jek Porkins. With plenty of new fate cards to bring new tension to every edge battle, the rivalries that exist between factions are about to become more explosive and dangerous than ever before!

Contains objective sets 246-250.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

description:
Set of 3 monster miniatures for Rising Sun:
Sacred Warrior - panda. Has +1 force for each Virtue card you have.
Phoenix - If Phoenix is killed, gain VP and return it to the same Province immediately.
Nure-Onna - Counts as 2 Force. Before resolving War in a Province, this may cross a Shipping Route to join that Battle.

Note: These monsters were included as stretch goals for the original Kickstarter campaign.

Add some spectral surprises and stranger things to your world with these spooky artefacts. Curses and crosses and crabs – oh my! Add more strategy to both Co-op and Battles mode. Expand your bestiary with Beasts alive and undead.

—description from the publisher

name: Ave Roma: MAGISTRATUS expansion
description: Magistratus gives each player a special ability that he/she has throughout the current game. Before the beginning of the game, shuffle all the cards and hand out two to each player. Each player should keep one, the other one goes back to the game box. Choose a side on the selected card and place it in front of you, next to your player board. Proceed with the game setup as described in the rulebook.
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Economic
mechanics: Set Collection, Trading, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Sailors (fan expansion for 7 Wonders)
description:
"By following the river, we arrive at the sea."
- Plautus

Come aboard and travel the seas. Exercise your natural skills for trade and interact with more players than before. You like the interaction, but you’re feeling more bellicose? Well, invade them rather than trade with them, or do both, after all, you rule on the seas. Control military and commercial maritime routes, and discover a new way to play.

This expansion adds one additional card to each Age per player. The new powers and abilities added on theses cards are mostly Maritime Trade and Invasion. Players may now initiate trade and military conflict with any other player, not just their immediate neighbors.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Diavolo Case (fan expansion for Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective)
description:
When we reach 221B Baker Street, Watson greets us. "Holmes is abuzz this morning, he’s waiting in the lounge."

"Ah, there you are at last gentlemen, have you read the paper?"

We shake our heads. "Direct your attentions to the article 'Mysterious death at the embassy.'"

Holmes pauses while we read...

So begins "The Diavolo Case," Yann Gentil's second extra-case expansion for Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective.

Available for download on the author's website (in French).

And translated into English by BGG Forum members and freely available in the Files section.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Storytelling

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Bioship Alpha Expansion Pack
description:
The bioship was an organic vessel that was used by Species 8472 and had a similar genetic makeup to their pilots. The bioships, and Species 8472 themselves, were resistant to assimilation by the Borg and had enough firepower to destroy a Borg ship with only a couple of shots. The bioships contained a series of vein-like conduits which carried electrodynamic fluid, possibly for use as an energy source.

Eight of these ships could collect and combine their firepower, using an energy focusing ship, which enabled them to fire a blast so powerful it could destroy a planet. When the Borg entered fluidic space, they were forced back by this resistance.

This ship is part of the 4th wave of expansion packs for the Star Trek: Attack Wing game.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Defenders of Rokugan
description:
For centuries, the Crab Clan have manned the Kaiu Wall with a ruthless efficiency. They stand against the legion of Shadowlands hordes with fierce determination and will do whatever it takes to make sure the Emerald Empire does not fall. These are the warriors who keep the horrors of Fu Leng at bay; these are the defenders of Rokugan.

Join the ranks of these samurai in Defenders of Rokugan, a Crab Clan Pack for Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game.

Defenders of Rokugan includes 78 new cards (three copies each of 23 different cards and one copy each of nine different cards) mostly focusing on the Crab Clan and their role as protectors of the Emerald Empire from the deadly southern Shadowlands.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game

description:
Rollo (P1) is a promo card for CloudAge, first given with preorders of the game.

Playing with the Promo Card "Rollo":
Rollo is the only project card you can play by paying metall and 2 project cards from the hand.
Rollo will produce every round in the production phase a project card (draw 1 project card).

Rollo is not meant to be part of the campaign - so the reference P1 means just Promo Card Number 1.
You can use it in every scenario/chapter if you wish.

name: De Kolonisten van Catan: Het Grote Kanaal
description:
"Het Grote Kanaal van Catan" (Catan's Great Canal) is a separately sold expansion to CATAN.

A large area of Catan is threatened by drought. The only way out is to dig an enormous canal from the sea to this area. All knights of Catan are summoned to get this job done. Attracted by large financial gains, they start working on the canal. Mostly together with other knights, the knights complete bit by bit of the canal. Finally the fields of Catan can be irrigated and Catan has wheat again.

Belongs to the Catan Series.

Expands

CATAN

name: Aventuria: Ship of Stone
description:
Forest without return & ship of lost souls collection box

Travia 28 Hal. Fleeing from the armies of the Borbaradian, the heroes cross the Trollzzacken and finally land in the mysterious Shadow Forest. There they are to track down a missing troll and return it to its clan. In the middle of the forest, they encounter a fog-covered moated castle, behind which the silhouette of a large ship appears. Or is it the other way around? The heroes face an adventurous battle against the illusionary horrors of the magician Zargor Nagachot.

An adventurous journey
The Stone Ship is a collection box for Aventuria - The Adventure Card Game. It contains all adventures and related game materials from the two Aventuria expansion boxes "Forest without Return" and "Ship of Lost Souls". It also includes the brand new expert adventure "The Stone Ship", which picks up elements from the two expansion boxes.
In addition, this box contains the Thorwal warrior Tjalva Garheltdottir and the Peraine consecrated Hilbert from Auen, as well as all the game materials needed to play these two heroes in both Duel and Adventure modes.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Rum & Bones: Second Tide – Mercenaries Hero's Chest
description:
These Heroes make a hearty crew, for the right price.

A good pirate captain is always on the lookout for some new recruits. They’ll lose some crew to scurvy, sunken ships, and in rare cases, retirement, so having a healthy supply of replacements on hand is crucial.

The Mercenaries Heroes Chest for Rum and Bones Second Tide, adds ten new Heroes willing to join any faction for the right price. These Heroes come with their own set of skills and special attacks. Any crew would be happy to have them on board!

This is an expansion. The Rum & Bones: Second Tide core game is required to play.

Features:


Mini Mercenaries - All ten of the included Mercenaries have their own highly detailed miniature figure and Hero Dashboards, allowing them to join any pirate crew.
Custom Cards - Each Hero comes with their own Skill cards that can be used to customize their abilities. As the game progresses, players will be able to choose how to develop them.

WO21 - Bolder than Before: 7-1/2 turns, board 76, 23 June 1941, Lvov, Ukraine

In two thrilling new missions that slot straight into an existing campaign you will purchase a shuttle, and then be forced to escape with it, and your lives…
